characters: BROOKLYN, NEW YORK. FIVE HOURS AGO.
SAN FRANCISCO, CALIFORNIA. ONE HOUR AGO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open hard on the passenger seat of a speeding minivan, wh a MALE TEENAGER is slumped against his blood-stained wind He’s dead, and a distinctly female voice is screaming in recognition of this horror. Pull out to reveal that this voice belongs to the minivan driver, the late teen’s MOTHER, who’s presumably racing t hospital.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Why? Why is this happening?! Pull out even more to reveal two more DEAD BOYS in the ba seats of the vehicle. More subtle this time. They’re slumped over their PSPs. We can’t see their faces.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Just hold on! I’m going to get you help! I’m-- The mother is cut off mid-sentence by EXPLODING GLASS, as windshield ruptures on impact with another vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut outside as a SPEEDING FIRE TRUCK runs a red light and easily KNOCKS ASIDE the minivan that dared cross its path

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the wheel, a rock-hard FEMALE FIREFIGHTER shakes h head at the smaller vehicle that stupidly ignored her bla sirens.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE FIREFIGHTER
dialogues.text: Fuckin’ women drivers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside, the street is LITTERED with crashed cars, most o which contain the CORPSES of recently deceased male drive A few small FIRES dot the landscape. This looks more like Fallujah than Jersey. The fire truck reluctantly slows to a halt as it confront JERSEY CITY POLICE CAR parked in the middle of the road. Outside the squaddie, a Hispanic FEMALE POLICE OFFICER i cradling the lifeless body of her MALE PARTNER, whose fac smeared with fresh blood. The female firefighter hops out of her vehicle to assist sister-in-arms.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE FIREFIGHTER
dialogues.text: Marianella!

dialogues.speaker: POLICEWOMAN
dialogues.text: They’re dead, Nat. The whole precinct.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE FIREFIGHTER
dialogues.text: I know, I’m the only one left from Ladder Ten. It’s... it’s gotta be Al Qaeda. Smallpox or something.

dialogues.speaker: POLICEWOMAN
dialogues.text: Then why are we okay? Why aren’t we-— The female officer is interrupted by the sudden arrival o AMBULANCE, which screeches to a halt inches from the two other emergency vehicles. A FEMALE EMT hops out and sprin over to the other uniformed women.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE EMT
dialogues.text: What the hell is happening? Dispatch says I’m the only bus responding to calls.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE FIREFIGHTER
dialogues.text: Is your dispatcher a woman? Suddenly, a WAILING SOUND is heard, like a distant wounde animal.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE EMT
dialogues.text: What difference does that make? The sound grows louder.

dialogues.speaker: POLICEWOMAN
dialogues.text: Is your dispatcher a fucking woman? !

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE EMT
dialogues.text: Yuh--yes. Yes. Why? The women raise their voices to compete with the alien so which is even louder now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s the men! All of the men are-- Pull out, as the sound reveals itself to be a BOEING 747. It’s falling out of the goddamn sky. A split-second before the plummeting aircraft crashes int this unlucky trio, we SMASH CUT to:

dialogues.speaker: YORICK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Did you know Elvis had a twin brother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside a tastefully decorated office, we learn that the v behind this non sequitur belongs to YORICK BROWN, an oddl attractive 20-something white guy who looks all wrong in tie. He’s wearing one anyway. Yorick’s staring right at u as he nervously rambles:

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: It’s true. Jesse Garon Presley. He was an identical twin, stillborn a few minutes before Gladys gave birth to the King. They buried him in a shoebox. How insane is that? I mean, what if Jesse had lived and Elvis had died? Or vice versa? It’s destiny, right? Why does fate choose one man over another and all that? Cut across the desk to the unimpressed FEMALE EXECUTIVE w apparently been interviewing Yorick.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE EXECUTIVE
dialogues.text: And that’s why we should hire you to be an assistant editor?

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: I'm just saying, I’m more Elvis than Jesse. Plus, I’m a ninja with the grammar. Ma’am. The woman looks over Yorick’s resume.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't worked since you graduated more than two years ago?

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: No, I’ve, uh, sorta been doing the Kerouac thing. Minus the road trip. Or traveling. Or leaving my apartment at all, really. I’ve been thinking. Mostly thinking.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE EXECUTIVE
dialogues.text: Mr. Brown...

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Yorick. Please. Mr. Brown is my father. My grandfather, actually. Professor Brown is my old man. He--

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE EXECUTIVE
dialogues.text: Yorick, I'll be honest. With your lack of publishing experience, I never even would have given you an interview if Congresswoman Brown hadn’t asked me personally.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: My... my mom called you?

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE EXECUTIVE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, son. You're a good kid, but you’re still a kid. Push in on Yorick, not quite ready to give up.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Did you know Nixon once deputized Elvis to be a secret agent?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The President is a bitch. INT. DOLL FACTORY —- MORNING It’s after hours inside a dimly lit DOLL FACTORY that’s cluttered with unassembled plastic body parts of girls’ t Standing under a naked bulb in this warehouse-sized room AGENT 355, a late-twenties African-American woman who cou kill you with a single dreadlock.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: If you want him dead, I’m your man. Pull out, as we reveal that Agent 355 is speaking with tw men, a seated RUSSIAN BUSINESSMAN and the nervous ASSISTA standing behind him.

dialogues.speaker: BUSINESSMAN
dialogues.text: And yet... you’re not. I am paying for an assassin, not a--

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: The woman comes very highly recommended, sir. She took down the head of Roberto Oil. In Venezuela? 355 smiles.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Haven’t you heard? We’re the deadlier of the species. If Mother Russia could hold onto her brides better, maybe you wouldn’t have to outsource all your dirty work. The frowning Russian businessman just stares at 355... bu his grimace eventually gives way to a smile.

dialogues.speaker: BUSINESSMAN
dialogues.text: You remind me of my first wife.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Messy divorce?

dialogues.speaker: BUSINESSMAN
dialogues.text: I cut her face off and had it stretched into a lampshade.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: (ignoring this) Give me the first ten million now, and POTUS will be dead before he leaves his stupid ranch. The businessman motions to his assistant, who brings 355 SUITCASE. Just as he’s about to hand over this case, 355 GRABS the assistant’s wrist and TWISTS it behind his back With her free hand, 355 pulls out a GLOCK, which she pres to her startled hostage’s head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Federal agent! You’re both under arrest!

dialogues.speaker: BUSINESSMAN
dialogues.text: Which federal agency?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: You're not really in a position to be asking questions, fuckface. The businessman calmly raises a finger, and GUNSHOTS ring as the hostage’s chest suddenly EXPLODES. The dead assist slumps to the ground, as SEVERAL HEAVILY ARMED RUSSIAN BRUISERS step out of the shadows behind their boss.

dialogues.speaker: BUSINESSMAN
dialogues.text: Hurt her as much as you want, but I get to finish it. 355’s eyes narrow, as she uses her free hand to pull out BALLISTIC BATON, which she EXTENDS with a satisfying THIN The first of the six thugs RUNS at 355, and she promptly SHOOTS him in the chest, knocking him to the ground. The next uses his muscular forearm to CHOP the Glock out 355’s hand, but she SWINGS her metal baton right into one his eye sockets. As this blinded man screams in pain, two more charge at 3 She GRABS the first by his thick neck and SNAPS it by usi his skull as a fulcrum to SWING around and KICK his partn in the face with devastating force. 355 continues to throw punches and break bones, until she eventually overpowered by Russian muscle. As the men wres her to the ground, 355 looks up to see the businessman holding one of his goons’ machine guns.

dialogues.speaker: BUSINESSMAN
dialogues.text: I’m going to enjoy reading by the light of your face. And with that, he SMASHES her in the skull with the butt the weapon, knocking her unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dejected Yorick shambles towards his rundown brownstone Queens, as an AIRPLANE roars directly overhead. He lives right next door to LaGuardia Airport. What a nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Yorick forces open the sticky front door, he’s greeted his very PREGNANT NEIGHBOR, who’s retrieving her mail.

dialogues.speaker: NEIGHBOR
dialogues.text: How'd it go, Yorick?

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Better than the last three?

dialogues.speaker: NEIGHBOR
dialogues.text: Well, you’ll get it next time. Yorick looks at her belly.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: You know yet or you want it to be a surprise?

dialogues.speaker: NEIGHBOR
dialogues.text: Oh, we just found out. Little boy.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Seriously? Congrats, that’s so-- The two are immediately interrupted by their TRANSVESTITE LANDLORD, a man trying (unconvincingly) to pass as a woma S/he angrily slings open the door to his/her ground floor apartment.

dialogues.speaker: TRANSVESTITE LANDLORD
dialogues.text: Something in your apartment smells like shit.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Oh. Yeah. Sorry. I... I think I burnt popcorn last--

dialogues.speaker: TRANSVESTITE LANDLORD
dialogues.text: It’s literally shit, Yorick. The lease says no animals! Yorick quickly gathers his bills and trudges up the stair

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: (under his breath) No, it says no cats or dogs... Yorick pushes into his dark pad, a hilariously tiny studi apartment decorated with posters of HOUDINI and other assorted nerdery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ampersand? Amp? Where are you, buddy? Your questionable hygiene has run its course, little man. Time for-- Suddenly, a DARK FIGURE steps out of the shadows, startli Yorick, who screams like a girl.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Who the hell are you? EXT. STREETS OF RAMALLAH —- EVENING This question belongs to COLONEL ALTER TSE’ELON, a thirty something soldier of the Israeli Defense Forces. She's holding a large MACHINE GUN and smoking casually, as are SOLDIERS, several of whom also happen to be female. Pull out to reveal that Alter is addressing an AMERICAN TELEVISION REPORTER and his CAMERAMAN.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: We're Americans.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: I never would have guessed. ALTER is joined by her second-in-command, an attractive y Israeli female soldier named RACHEL.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: They're doing a piece on female combat soldiers, Alter.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: They're not doing anything until our patrol is finished. Suddenly, GUNSHOTS ring out. The reporter and his cameram flinch, but the Israeli soldiers just casually toss their cigarettes aside.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Are... are they shooting at us, um, Alter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Colonel Tse’elon, and you will address me as such. Come, my team and I will get you to safety. The reporter subtly signals for his cameraman to keep filming, as Alter escorts the crew double-time through th dark streets.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: So, how did you--

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: Twenty-one months of military service is compulsory for all Israeli women.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Yeah, but this is sort of a new phenomenon, right? Women on the front lines?

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: My grandmother crossed into enemy territory during our War of Independence, and her grandmother was part of the all-female Battalion of Death during the Russian Revolution. Alter stops, and turns to speak directly into the videographer’s camera.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: Defending our territory at any cost is in women’s blood, as the new crop of girls strapping on bomb belts for Islamic Jihad will be happy to-- Without warning, a nearby car EXPLODES in a deafening bur of sound and fury, KNOCKING everyone to the ground. INT. YORICK’S APARTMENT —- MORNING Matching this flash, a frightened Yorick flips on his LIG SWITCH, illuminating an unexpected vision standing before him: a 20-something blonde bombshell named BETH DEVILLE, too beautiful for a geek like Yorick... or is she? Beth’s wearing a TRENCHCOAT that’s closed tight over her thin bo  10

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Beth?

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Hey, handsome.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: I thought you weren’t coming over for another-- She kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: You talk too much. Yorick smiles, as he looks down at her coat.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: What’s with the trench? You’re flying to sunny Los Angeles, not old-timey London.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: I’m insulted. This is what I wore to our first date, remember? Midnight screening of Miller's Crossing at the Angelika? You said I looked like a degenerate flasher.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: That wasn’t our date! You were still seeing my troglodyte of a roommate.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: So, you were seeing Libby!

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: You guys set me up with her! And she covered her eyes every time someone in the movie got shot.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Well, my date kept falling asleep.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: (pulling Beth close) But right after the Danny Boy scene, when Leo blew that guy’s brains out and stole his tommy gun, you turned to me and whispered, “That was the coolest motherfucking thing I’ve ever seen.”  He kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: And that’s when I knew you were the only degenerate flasher I would ever love.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: And that’s when I knew I needed a better wardrobe. Beth undoes her trenchcoat, revealing skimpy LINGERIE underneath. Yorick is predictably awestruck.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Wow. I mean, that is--

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Shh. It’s a going-away present.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: But, I’m not the one leaving town... unless those pharmaceutical nerds want you so bad, they've thrown in an extra ticket. Beth sighs. They’ve obviously had this conversation befor

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: My internship’s only for three months, Yorick.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Sure, until you discover the cure for cancer, and they offer you-- Fed up, Beth PUSHES Yorick to the floor and climbs on top him.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Do you have protection? Yorick fumbles for a nearby box. He tips it over and out spills DUCT TAPE, a GASMASK, and various CANNED GOODS.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Do you have anthrax? Beth kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: It’s fine.  12 She starts grinding against him.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Are... are you sure that’s safe?

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’m on the shot. Yorick kisses her back, but stops abruptly.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Wait, what shot? Beth smiles.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: The one I invented. Close on Yorick’s panicked expression.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What the hell are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing outside of a large convention center ballroom is VICTORIA, a conservatively dressed redhead in her late thirties. She’s arguing with a REGISTRATION OFFICIAL, whi dozens of MALE GRANDMASTERS play chess behind him.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: I registered months ago!

dialogues.speaker: REGISTRATION OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Mrs.--

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: It's Ms. If they didn’t put it under my last name, try Victoria.

dialogues.speaker: REGISTRATION OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: Ma’am, it doesn’t matter what your name is, I can’t let you compete. The women’s tournament isn’t until next week.  13

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: “Women's?” We're playing chess. This is a competition of the mind!

dialogues.speaker: REGISTRATION OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: You'll have to take that up with the organizers, ma’am.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: You call me “ma’am” one more time, I‘ll rip out your hair plugs.

dialogues.speaker: REGISTRATION OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: Security! Two MEN IN BLUE BLAZERS rush over to remove Victoria.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: I’m a grandmaster! I could beat any man in that room! The security officers GRAB Victoria, but she shakes them and steps away from the registration table. On her way ou of the center, she looks back and threatens:

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: There’s a reason the queen is the most powerful piece, you know! INT. YORICK’S APARTMENT - DAY Back in his pad, a post-coital Yorick is in bed now, lyin next to a disrobed Beth.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Was that okay? Beth smiles as she runs her fingers over his chest.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Which part of “faster, harder, again” confused you?

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: No, I mean, about me finishing, um, inside you. Beth rolls over, a little hurt.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Yorick, this is what got me my stupid scholarship. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 14 BETH (cont'd) The hormones I synthesized are just as effective as the pill.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Then why not just take that?

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Because if it weren’t for researches being brave enough to test shit on themselves, we'd still have malaria and anemia and a million other diseases.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: You don’t have a disease, Beth. (a nervous beat) Do you? Beth stands, covering herself in a blanket.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Baby, you have no idea what it’s like to bleed for days on end. But the science exists for women to permanently suppress ovulation, to get rid of the monthly visitor forever.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: I thought you were the one girl who didn’t mind the sight of blood.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: (a little melancholy) Yeah, well... people change, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: As long as you’re sure it, you know, works. Beth smiles again, as she rubs her flat stomach.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: I promise, the last thing I want is any little surprises in my-- Suddenly, a SMALL CREATURE leaps out of the shadows and l on Beth’s shoulder. Understandably, she SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: SAN FRANCISCO, CALIFORNIA. ONE HOUR AGO.
dialogues.text: 15 A SCREECHING ANIMAL is heard under this title card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside a hi-tech facility, a RAT hisses in pain as it’s injected with a long syringe. Pull out to reveal that we’re in a laboratory FILLED with CAGED LAB ANIMALS (mice, baboons, etc.). The scientist behind this experiment is DR. ALLISON MANN, a stoic Chine American woman in her early thirties.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: Easy, girl. It only hurts the first time.

dialogues.speaker: VISITOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’ve used that line a few times myself. Mann turns to see her VISITOR, an intimidating man wearin the kind of standard-issue black suit that suggests you’r about to be killed or audited or both.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: Then here’s a new one for you. “No means no.” I’ve told you a hundred times, I’m not interested in helping you.

dialogues.speaker: VISITOR
dialogues.text: Dr. Mann, China is dangerously close to becoming a peer competitor to the United States, and unless we can slow the growth of its strategic arsenal--

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: Why are you people coming to me? I'm Chinese!

dialogues.speaker: VISITOR
dialogues.text: No, you're Chinese-American, and if you had any love for your heritage or the family you left behind, Dr. Ming, you wouldn’t have taken your new name from a faux-Oriental movie theater in L.A.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: (coldly) I was eighteen when I did that.  16

dialogues.speaker: VISITOR
dialogues.text: Doctor, your country needs you.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: I’m interested in creating life, not destroying it.

dialogues.speaker: VISITOR
dialogues.text: Yeah, but your work isn’t cheap, is it? It'd be a shame if your funding suddenly expired. Mann stops what she’s doing.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: Are you threatening me?

dialogues.speaker: VISITOR
dialogues.text: Look, Allison, we’re not interested in hurting anyone. We’re just looking for ways to alter the geopolitical landscape if and when push comes to shove with the People’s Republic.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: Whatever, along with being junk science, your plan is a grotesque violation of the natural order.

dialogues.speaker: VISITOR
dialogues.text: And animal cloning isn't?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: Every twin on the planet is a “clone.” There’s a precedent. What you’re suggesting is impossible. The Visitor tosses a classified file folder onto Mann’s d It’s labelled “SETTING SON: PRIMATE RESEARCH PROPOSAL”

dialogues.speaker: VISITOR
dialogues.text: We'll see.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: VISITOR
dialogues.text: The first step. Call me if you want to be there for the second.  17 Before exiting the lab, the Visitor taps on one of the sleeping baboon’s glass prisons, causing the frothing ani to SPRING to life. INT. YORICK’S APARTMENT - DAY A mortified Yorick screams at his off-screen pet.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Ampersand, no! Cut over to Beth, who is trying to pry AMPERSAND, a male capuchin HELPER MONKEY, off of her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: What the hell is it?

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: (drawing a “&” in the air with his finger) You know, that curly symbol for “and,” like in Turner & Hooch or--

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: I know what an ampersand is, asshat. What is... ow! As the diaper-clad monkey BITES Beth’s finger, Yorick rea out to take the animal.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry. He’s supposed to be a helper monkey.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Please don’t tell me you’ve gotten that lazy.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: It’s not for me. I volunteered to train this feces-slinging bastard to help quadriplegics with their daily chores and shit. I wanted to have him ready before you left, but he got stuck in customs after some kind of paperwork screw-up, so--

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Yorick, you couldn’t keep sea monkeys alive. Why would you do that?  18 Beth walks into the tiny bathroom to wash her wound, clos the door behind her and leaving Yorick alone with his pet

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I guess I just wanted to use my abundant free time to help people. I mean, you and the rest of my globetrotting pals are off saving the world or whatever, and I haven’t done a goddamn thing for anyone.

dialogues.speaker: BETH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yorick, look. Before I go, there's... there’s something I need to tell you. Yorick pulls a tiny BOX out of a nearby drawer, and looks down at the little cube thoughtfully.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Wait, me first. I’ve been meaning to say this for a long time. He opens the box, revealing a modest ENGAGEMENT RING. As speaks, Beth runs the water in the bathroom, just barely drowning out his quiet voice.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Beth, you're brilliant and sexy and you know the names of all six and half of the Three Stooges. I didn’t even know they made women like you. I want to spend-- Yorick nervously SHUTS the little ring box as Beth steps of the bathroom, now wearing conservative attire.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: I should really go, baby. Before Yorick can protest, she kisses him deeply.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: I’1l call you every day, okay?

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Wait, um, can I at least carry your bags? Beth reaches out to pet Ampersand with her newly bandaged finger.  19

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: You should probably stay here and take care of Chim Chim, huh? Besides, it’s not like I have very far to walk. On cue, the windows in Yorick’s apartment begin to RATTLE a passenger jet THUNDERS directly overhead. A dejected Yorick watches Beth leave, as Ampersand picks something out of his hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent 355 is now seated in a folding chair, with her hand HANDCUFFED behind her. The bruises on her face suggest th she’s been tortured for the last few hours by the Russian mobster and his henchmen.

dialogues.speaker: BUSINESSMAN
dialogues.text: I‘1l ask you one more time, what is your name?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: I told you, I’m Agent 355.

dialogues.speaker: BUSINESSMAN
dialogues.text: Fuck the rank and serial number bullshit! Tell me your name!

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: My colleagues will be here any second now.

dialogues.speaker: BUSINESSMAN
dialogues.text: It’s been hours. If anyone knew where you were, they would have been here already. Now tell me who you work for. 355 says nothing, as the businessman begins playing with collapsible baton he took from her. He’s suggestively extending and retracting the hard metal rod.

dialogues.speaker: BUSINESSMAN
dialogues.text: If you can’t put words in your mouth... perhaps we will find something else to put in there. As the businessman nods, one of his henchmen UNZIPS his p and approaches 355, who bravely grits her teeth.  20

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the aftermath of the explosion, several Israeli ARMORE VEHICLES have arrived to provide backup (and escort the shaken American reporter and his cameraman to safety). A bandaged Alter is smoking on top of a parked TANK, as Rac her second-in-command arrives with a situation report.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: How many?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Six injured, two dead. Noa and Sagee. Alter takes a long drag off her cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: Thank you, Rachel. Just then, male voices (speaking Hebrew) are heard scream over Rachel’s radio. Gradually, the screaming becomes LIVE, as the male soldie surrounding them begin to scream as well.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: The hell...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victoria is sitting on a park bench, watching as overweig men in business suits walk past. She's rolling a PAWN PIECE back and forth across her knuckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a baby CRIES somewhere in the plane’s cabin, a pensive Beth is looking out her window at the world far below. Sh the only person in her aisle.

dialogues.speaker: AFRICAN-AMERICAN MAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Beth turns to see a handsome thirty-something AFRICAN- AMERICAN MAN.  21

dialogues.speaker: AFRICAN-AMERICAN MAN
dialogues.text: Really sorry to bother you, but that kid is driving me insane. Mind if I sit here? Beth looks up at him. A brief beat.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Not at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Mann paces as she talks on her cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: Listen to me, you have to stop this now. I/’11 give you whatever you want, but if you go through with this without my guidance... The doctor looks up as she hears one of her animals whimp in pain. She returns to her phone, but the line’s dead.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: Hello? dHello...? INT. YORICK’S APARTMENT - DAY A dejected Yorick feeds small pieces of fruit to his monk who promptly FLINGS them across the room.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Just you and me now.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK TEXT ON WHITE BACKGROUND
dialogues.text: Now

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earth hangs silently in the void. At the speed of light, ZOOM IN on the planet, until we co to rest on an ABORIGINAL MAN in the Australian Outback. He coughs into his hand, and looks down to see a few drop BLOOD.  22

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As one of the menacing Russian henchmen approaches the handcuffed Agent 355, she KICKS him in the knee, painfull HYPEREXTENDING the joint. He collapses, and 355 uses the momentum to FALL backwards and SLIDE free of her chair. W her hands still cuffed behind her, she WHEEL KICKS to her feet... only to find the Russian businessman with his gun pressed to her temple. 355 closes her eyes and prepares for the worst, when this suddenly begins coughing violently. She watches in disbel as he begins to VOMIT blood. The businessman drops his gun and 355’s baton to grab at own throat, as he suddenly begins to bleed out of his eye nose and ears. His henchmen soon follow suit. 355 can only watch in stunned confusion as the Russian terrorists die painful deaths, leaving her all alone in t quiet factory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lone SECRETARY screams in terror as hundreds of JAPANES BUSINESSMEN begin to bleed out of every orifice in a tsun of crimson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As male soldiers begin to drop left and right, Rachel pul out a HYPODERMIC and screams in Hebrew at her fellow troo

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: It’s an attack! Use your atropine! But before she can inject herself, Alter GRABS the young soldier's wrist.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: No. This can’t be gas. It’s... it’s just the men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of NUNS scream at each other in Italian as they c the lifeless bodies of several CATHOLIC PRIESTS.  23 EXT. CLEVELAND PARK — DAY As the male contingent of the morning rush collapses to t sidewalk, push in on Victoria, who sets down her chess piece... and SMILES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scantily clad PROSTITUTES press against the glass of thei storefront windows to look out at the JOHNS bleeding out across the streets of the Netherlands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As her male lab animals writhe in pain, an enraged Dr. Ma picks up a heavy glass beaker and THROWS it against the w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FEMALE GIRAFFE stands watch over the body of her lifele MATE, as a train spectacularly DERAILS in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As FRIGHTENED FEMALE PASSENGERS cry and scream, Beth push her way past her now deceased aisle-mate to accost a catatonic FLIGHT ATTENDANT. The suddenly pilotless plane ROCKS to one side, knocking Beth into the woman.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: We have to get inside that cockpit!

dialogues.speaker: FLIGHT ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: What’s the point? This is the Rapture. God didn’t choose us.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? This is some kind of... of germ warfare! Why would God only take the men?

dialogues.speaker: FLIGHT ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: Because we’re the daughters of Eve. We created sin when we tempted Adam in the-- A furious Beth PULLS the flight attendant close to her by front of her uniform and whispers an inch from her face.  24

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Listen to me, you dumb bitch. You will pull yourself together and help us land this plane or me and every woman in this cabin will kick the living shit out of you in hell. The flight attendant stares at her blankly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A frantic FEMALE NASA SCIENTIST rushes past her recently deceased MISSION CONTROL COLLEAGUES to attend to hundreds flashing lights.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE VOICE FROM SPEAKER
dialogues.text: (through heavy static) Houston, Houston... do you read...? INT. YORICK’S APARTMENT - DAY Yorick is startled by the sound of a distant CRASH, follo by muffled screams outside his door. Carrying Ampersand on his shoulder, he nervously steps ou into his hallway, only to see his transvestite landlord collapsed on the floor. His/her long wig is lying ina puddle of blood.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Briana...? Yorick looks up when he hears faint whimpering on the stairwell. He races over to find the pregnant neighbor wo he spoke with earlier. There’s blood running down her leg and she’s CRADLING something we can’t quite see in her ar

dialogues.speaker: NEIGHBOR
dialogues.text: I... I lost him, Yorick. Hearing cries of help coming from the street, Yorick reluctantly leaves this woman to step outside. There, he’ greeted by A DEAD MAILMAN, A DEAD DELIVERY BOY, A DEAD HOMELESS MAN, and much, much more male carnage. Women run in fear and confusion, as a plane SMASHES into AIR TRAFFIC CONTROL TOWER in the background. Horrified beyond words, Yorick can only cover his mouth, while the animal on his shoulder SCREAMS.  25

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This suburban street is crowded with crashed cars. A larg sign reads: “LADIES: DUSK-TO-DAWN CURFEW STRICTLY ENFORCE Pull out to reveal a LONE FIGURE. This person is holding of those small ANIMAL CARRIERS for little dogs, and weari HOODED PONCHO and GASMASK not unlike the one we saw in a certain emergency preparedness kit earlier. It’s Yorick. Suddenly, a blaring HORN is heard, as the disguised Yoric DIVES out of the way to avoid being hit by an out-of-cont GARBAGE TRUCK, which careens into a nearby tree.

dialogues.speaker: WASHINGTON, D.C. SIX WEEKS LATER.
dialogues.text: A dazed woman steps out of the truck’s smoking cab. By al accounts, she’s a SUPERMODEL, a stunningly gorgeous 19-ye old woman wearing the odd combination of fashionably tigh attire and heavy-duty work gloves.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMODEL
dialogues.text: Oh my god. Lady, are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: (muffled by gasmask) I... I’m fine.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMODEL
dialogues.text: You sure? What’s wrong with your voice?

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Just... got the wind knocked out of me.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMODEL
dialogues.text: I am so sorry. I just started driving this thing, and I still suck at braking. Doesn’t exactly handle like my old Miata, you know? I should probably...  26 The Supermodel walks around to the back of her garbage tr and reacts with disappointment.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMODEL
dialogues.text: Aw, shit.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMODEL
dialogues.text: They fell out. Cut to the back of the truck, where several BADLY DECOMPO MALE CORPSES have fallen out of the vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Oh, Christ. They’re... they’re all...

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMODEL
dialogues.text: Yep, all mine. But if you gimme a quick hand with these dudes, I might consider sharing the profits.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: This... this is your job?

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMODEL
dialogues.text: I know, right? It’s been more than a month, and there are still a ton of single dudes rotting in their apartments. She starts dragging one of the lighter corpses.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMODEL
dialogues.text: Everyone’s worried about diseases and shit, so the CDC pays me a can of food for every corpse I bring in. Only work I could find. Fucked up, huh? Yorick picks up his ANIMAL CARRIER and looks inside to ma sure its occupant is still safe. A little MONKEY’S PAW reaches out before Yorick pushes it back in.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMODEL
dialogues.text: I used to have a modeling contract with Wilhelmina, and now I’ma goddamn garbage girl. Worst part is, I spent three grand on my boobs two days before the Plague hit. Fat lot of good our tits do us now.  27

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: What do you do with these bodies?

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMODEL
dialogues.text: I take ‘em over to RFK. No one’s using the stadium anymore, so they turned it into one of those... whatchamacallits. Crematoriums. Yorick tries not to puke.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMODEL
dialogues.text: You all right? Take a few deep breaths. You don’t have to wear that mask anymore, you know. If whatever wiped them out could've hurt us, we'd be dead already. The masked figure turns and walks away from the confused model, leaving her alone with her work.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, better safe than sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later that evening, the masked figure arrives at an expen home, completely unlit thanks to the lack of electricity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yorick pushes his way inside the dark foyer. He finally takes off his mask, revealing a few days worth of stubble

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Hello? Is anybody-- Without warning, a figure steps out of the shadows and CL Yorick in the head with a heavy MAG FLASHLIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Ow! Son of a bitch! Yorick rubs his head as he turns to see the woman we’1ll learn is his MOTHER, Congresswoman Jennifer Brown.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Literally, I guess. The woman turns on the flashlight to get a better look at young man she just struck.  28

dialogues.speaker: CONGRESSWOMAN BROWN
dialogues.text: Yorick? Is... is that you?

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Hi, mom. The congresswoman DROPS her flashlight and EMBRACES her s

dialogues.speaker: CONGRESSWOMAN BROWN
dialogues.text: I prayed every second, Yorick. I prayed every second for you, but I never thought--

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. It took me weeks just to get out of New York. Yorick’'s mother begins to WEEP tears of joy. She hugs hi again, stroking his hair so hard she’s almost pulling it

dialogues.speaker: CONGRESSWOMAN BROWN
dialogues.text: Tell me this is real. Please. I can’t live through another goddamn dream like this, Yorick. I can’t--

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: It’s real. I checked on all my friends. David and Jeff and Dan and Jay and--

dialogues.speaker: CONGRESSWOMAN BROWN
dialogues.text: And are you...?

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: The only one? I think so. Unless dad... I mean, is daddy still...? Congresswoman Brown wipes away her tears, and gives her s look that clearly says “No.”

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Damn. Goddamn it. GODDAMN IT! Yorick PUNCHES a wall as hard as he can. He collapses to the floor, taking a seat next to his pet carrier. Yorick dries his eyes with the back of a sleeve.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: I... I thought maybe it was hereditary. I thought whatever kept me alive might have--  29 Suddenly, the door to the pet carrier SPRINGS open, and Ampersand comes SCURRYING out. Yorick’s mom reacts the sa way everybody does to this animal.

dialogues.speaker: CONGRESSWOMAN BROWN
dialogues.text: Jesus! What the hell is that?

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: His name’s Ampersand. I’m training him to be a helper monkey. I was, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: CONGRESSWOMAN BROWN
dialogues.text: Him? But the NSA says every male mammal-—

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: I don’t know, but whatever kept me alive must have also shielded this guy.

dialogues.speaker: CONGRESSWOMAN BROWN
dialogues.text: Or maybe that animal is carrying something that shielded you from whatever killed all the other men.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Huh. Guess I hadn’t considered that. Yorick’s mom subtly shakes her head. She loves this kid, he clearly hasn’t thought through his situation.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Whatever. I’m all alone.

dialogues.speaker: CONGRESSWOMAN BROWN
dialogues.text: (squeezing his hand) We don’t know that, honey boy. Have you talked with Beth?

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: No, she was in a plane when everything went down, and... and there are pieces of 747s strewn everywhere. I mean, what percentage of pilots were women? Four? Five?

dialogues.speaker: CONGRESSWOMAN BROWN
dialogues.text: Yorick. There’s something you should hear.  30

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut inside the study of the late Professor Brown, where Yorick’'s mom is playing a message from the family answer machine. Ampersand is sitting on Yorick’s shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: FROM MACHINE
dialogues.text: You have one saved message.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Wait, your phone still works?

dialogues.speaker: CONGRESSWOMAN BROWN
dialogues.text: If there’s an operator on duty. Now quiet. My generator doesn’t have much juice left.

dialogues.speaker: FROM MACHINE
dialogues.text: Mrs. Brown? I’m... I’m sorry to bother you.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: (relieved) Beth.

dialogues.speaker: FROM MACHINE
dialogues.text: I... I don’t know what’s going on back on the East Coast, but I just lived through an emergency landing, and I’m on my way to L.A. I can’t get a hold of your son, but if he’s still... if he’s still around, I’m sure he’ll come to you first. Please tell him -beep- Congresswoman Brown turns off the machine.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: I’m going to her.

dialogues.speaker: CONGRESSWOMAN BROWN
dialogues.text: Don't be absurd, Yorick.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: She needs me!

dialogues.speaker: CONGRESSWOMAN BROWN
dialogues.text: And we'll find someone to bring her to you, but you’re potentially this country’s--this world’s--most valuable resource. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 31 CONGRESSWOMAN BROWN (cont'd) The rest of the government has to know about you, so we can decide what to do next.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: What rest of the government, mom? I mean, who’s even in charge here?

dialogues.speaker: CONGRESSWOMAN BROWN
dialogues.text: President Rice.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: ("We're fucked.) Condi?

dialogues.speaker: CONGRESSWOMAN BROWN
dialogues.text: I don’t want to hear any of that misogynist bullshit from you, kid. Other countries didn’t collapse under Thatcher or Indira or... or Mier, and we're going to hold it together, too.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Yeah, but what about Congress? Aren't, like, 90% of you dead? You’re the one who always complained that fucking Burundi had more female politicians than us!

dialogues.speaker: CONGRESSWOMAN BROWN
dialogues.text: And you might be able to help us change that.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: How, by locking me in the Oval Office so I can be a...a stud for however many women you want me to inseminate?

dialogues.speaker: CONGRESSWOMAN BROWN
dialogues.text: I have no intention of whoring out my own son, Yorick. But you need to be somewhere safe. Yorick’s mom gently pushes her son (and his animal) outsi the study.

dialogues.speaker: CONGRESSWOMAN BROWN
dialogues.text: Now go upstairs, get some sleep. We'll figure out the rest of this in the morning. Before closing the door, she tries to reassure Yorick.  32

dialogues.speaker: CONGRESSWOMAN BROWN
dialogues.text: Everything’s going to be all right, kid. I love you. Alone now, Yorick turns to look at his empty house. INT. YORICK’S CHILDHOOD BEDROOM - NIGHT Upstairs, Yorick carries his monkey into his boyhood room which is lit only by what moonlight streams inside. Yorick notices a few boxes labelled “NYU,” leftover memor from his last year at college. He opens one of these cardboard containers, and pulls out an UNFRAMED PHOTOGRAP It’s a picture of him with Beth at a college Halloween pa Yorick is wearing a STRAITJACKET, and Beth is dressed in top hat and fishnet stockings of a MAGICIAN’S ASSISTANT. Beth is holding up bunny ears behind the laughing Yorick. He flips the picture over, and scribbled on the back is a hand-written note from Beth that reads, “YORICK BROWN + B DEVILLE = DRUNKEN MAGIC FOREVER” Yorick smiles, but his happiness fades as he thinks of ho far away his best friend is. He clutches the photo agains his chest, falls back into his old bed, and closes his ey INT. YORICK’S CHILDHOOD BEDROOM - LATER THAT NIGHT Smash cut to a few hours later for this image of a sleepi Yorick, as his eyes suddenly SPRING OPEN. We can hear peo ARGUING off-screen. A nervous Yorick quietly opens his bedroom door to look d at the verbal fight transpiring in the foyer just below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Downstairs, Yorick’s mother is yelling at TWO ATHLETIC- LOOKING FEMALE SECRET SERVICE AGENTS.

dialogues.speaker: CONGRESSWOMAN BROWN
dialogues.text: This wasn't part of our deal! You told me you were just going to escort him to the White House!

dialogues.speaker: SECRET SERVICE AGENT
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, ma‘am. There just aren’t enough Secret Service agents left to guarantee his safety there.  33

dialogues.speaker: CONGRESSWOMAN BROWN
dialogues.text: Then where are you taking him?

dialogues.speaker: SECRET SERVICE AGENT
dialogues.text: To a classified location.

dialogues.speaker: CONGRESSWOMAN BROWN
dialogues.text: Like fuck you are! This is my child! I’m not going to let you kidnap him!

dialogues.speaker: SECRET SERVICE AGENT
dialogues.text: Ma’am, please lower your voice. This is above all our heads, so... Just then, the Secret Service agent looks upstairs and catches a glimpse of Yorick in his bedroom doorway. He immediately SLAMS the door shut.

dialogues.speaker: SECRET SERVICE AGENT
dialogues.text: (to her partner) Take him. INT. YORICK’S CHILDHOOD BEDROOM —- CONTINUING Panicking, Yorick THROWS on his backpack and STUFFS Amper inside his carrier. His mom’s voice can be heard off-scre as can the heavy footsteps of the rapidly approaching age

dialogues.speaker: CONGRESSWOMAN BROWN, (0O.S.)
dialogues.text: Yorick, I’m sorry! I’m so sorry! Yorick starts to climb out his second-story window, but before he does, he reaches back and grabs the photo of BE The two Secret Service agents soon KICK OPEN his flimsily locked door... but Yorick has already disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DROPPING to a concrete patio, Yorick (still carrying Ampersand’s case) LANDS awkwardly and stumbles to his fee He races for the side of his house, where he finds a larg shape covered by a white sheet. Yorick yanks it off, revealing an old HARLEY MOTORCYCLE. Frantically, he start tipping over lawn equipment and nearby bags of plant food looking for its KEYS.  34

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: (quietly) Come on, dad, a little help here... Finally, Yorick cracks open a can of paint, grabs the hid treasure inside, and JAMS the key into the bike’s ignitio It roars to life, just as the two S.S. agents storm outsi The women GRAB for Yorick (who’s riding the bike while carrying Amp’s case on his lap), but he deftly out-maneuv them, and RACES out into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later that evening, Yorick (again wearing his hood and gasmask) WEAVES through the cluttered D.C. intersections his father’s old motorcycle. Ampersand’s carrier is now t onto the back of the bike. Confident that he’s no longer being followed, he stops at makeshift roadblock to catch his breath and find his bearings. Suddenly, Yorick hears the sound of SINGING. He turns to a FUNERAL PROCESSION, hundreds of women marching down the street carrying candles, flowers and mementos of their fa brothers, husbands and sons. In the middle of the crowd, Yorick spots someone else wea a GASMASK. Could this be another male in disguise? Yorick slows his bike next to this masked figure.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Excuse me. You’re not a... are you a...? The figure pulls off the mask, revealing a weathered fort something rocker chick. This is HEATHER.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: I know you, sweetie?

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Oh, I... I saw the mask, and I thought maybe you were... I thought Maybe you were someone I knew.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Sorry, just got so used to wearing this thing, it’s kinda become my security blanket. I’m Heather, by the by.  35 She holds out her hand for Yorick to shake.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: I’m... Beth. Where are you guys headed?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Oh, they turned one of the monuments into a kinda memorial for all the men.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Which monument?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Guess. Heather points up at the nearby WASHINGTON MONUMENT, look particularly phallic in the moonlight.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Always about size with you ladies, isn’t it? Just then, Yorick hears the rumble of MORE motorcycles, a turns to see a gang of several DAUGHTERS OF THE AMAZON ci this ad hoc shrine to men. These post-apocalyptic survivalists have RIFLES and other weapons slung over their backs, and numerous MEN’S NECKTI attached to their belts, like freshly shorn scalps. Two o these women are wearing full-face HELMETS.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: The hell?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Daughters of the Amazon.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: I’ve only heard rumors. They're, like, roving packs of pissed-off lesbians, right?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: They’re not gay, they’re crazy. Been burning down all the sperm banks.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Why?  36

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Who knows? Some girls will do any stupid shit to get into a gang, long as it means food and protection. Push in on the bikers, as one of the helmeted women (the apparent leader) removes her helmet to address the crowd mourners. It’s the female chess grandmaster, VICTORIA.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Sisters, why do you continue to worship at the altar of the patriarchy? The gendercide is cause for celebration! It rid the planet of rapists and dictators and serial killers! The Y chromosome was an genetic aberration, one that the planet rightly expunged! As the largely frightened crowd scatters, Victoria spots disguised Yorick in the background. She turns to two of h underlings, THERESA (a young woman with a completely shav head) and CATHERINE (the other helmeted Amazon).

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Theresa, Catherine... a pound of Godiva to whoever brings me that woman's bike. While the rest of the Daughters of the Amazon begin attac some kind of ELECTRONIC DEVICE to the base of the Washing Monument, Catherine and Theresa hop on their bikes and sp towards Yorick.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Oh. Oh, crap. Yorick squeezes the throttle, and his bike JUMPS to life. squeals past a bewildered Heather, with the two Amazons i hot pursuit. Zooming down a side street and away from the crowds, Yorick does his best to out-race his two pursuers but Theresa (the bald one) pulls out a handgun and FIRES Yorick’'s back tire, causing his bike to LOSE CONTROL and SPARK to a painful halt on its chromed side. Ampersand WHINES from inside his carrier, as Yorick pulls himself out from under the bike.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: (groggy, to Ampersand) Well, how do you think I feel?  37 Yorick looks up to see the two Daughters of the Amazon standing over him. Theresa has her gun trained on his fac

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: I'll take the mask, too, whore.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, I... I can’t. The helmeted rider begs Yorick to be sensible.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Just do what she says, lady. Reluctantly, Yorick peels off the gasmask, and the two wo react with appropriate shock and awe to his stubbled face

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: You're... you’re... Yorick stands and puts on his best female impersonator vo

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: (terrible female impersonation) It’s just glandular, okay?

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: You have an Adam's apple. Theresa steps forward and puts a HAND down the front of Yorick’s PANTS.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Hey! What are you--

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: He’s a man... but just barely. Yorick pulls away, offended.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: What are you going to do, rape me?

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Don’t flatter yourself. I’m taking you to my boss.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: No. You’re not. Theresa turns to see Catherine's gun in her face.  38

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Jesus, Catherine, we can split the fucking chocolate. “Catherine” finally removes her helmet, revealing that sh actually AGENT 355.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: My name’s not Catherine.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? I’ve been bunking with you for a week. You’ re-- Without hesitating, 355 PISTOL-WHIPS Theresa, instantly knocking the girl out. Yorick FLINCHES in fear as 355 aim the gun at him, but she instead fires at the front tire o Theresa’s BIKE, before jumping back on her own motorcycle

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: (to Yorick) Hop on.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Like hell, Warrior Princess.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: I’m not an Amazon. I’m an agent of the Culper Ring. Yorick picks up his carrier to make sure that Ampersand i safe.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: The what?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Forget it. We should go before the fireworks begin.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: What fireworks? Suddenly, a deafening EXPLOSION is heard, and Yorick turn just in time to watch the Washington Monument TOPPLE on i side, felled like a marbled redwood. As the dust from the demolition spreads their way, Yorick matter-of-factly climbs onto 355’'s bike.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Right. And away we go.  39 INT. TEL AVIV COMMAND CENTER —- MORNING Cut to an Israeli war room, where countless YOUNG FEMALE CADETS man phone banks and computer screens. Rachel is looking up at a BIG MAP of the Middle East with her commander, Alter. This display shows heavy TROOP MOVEMENT out of Israel and into Lebanon, Syria and Egypt.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: When does it end?

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: When our people are safe.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Our people are safe, Alter... thanks to you. But we no longer have their support. The women want security, not world domination.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: Security must be earned, Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: It was already given to us when the boys died! Israel has more combat- ready soldiers than any nation on the planet now, and you know it! You have every teenage girl in Tel Aviv eavesdropping on 192 badly fractured governments, and unless the three girls on board that Australian submarine decide to invade the Mediterranean, there are no more threats to us! We’re-- Suddenly, a young girl wearing headphones calls Alter ove her listening station.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO GIRL
dialogues.text: Lieutenant-General Tse’elon! I have something! Alter gives Rachel a knowing look.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: (to the Radio Girl) On speaker, soldier. Over the tinny speaker, the voice of one of the female SE SERVICE AGENTS is heard.  40

dialogues.speaker: FROM SPEAKER
dialogues.text: I have not been drinking, Madame President. Congresswoman Brown's son is alive, and now he’s somewhere out there. We--

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Another delusional crackpot.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: Perhaps, but all it would take is our enemies finding a single boy for them to resurrect their entire armies.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: What? You’re not seriously considering wasting resources on some wild goose chase, are you? Alter shoots Rachel daggers before pulling the young woma aside to quietly lecture her.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: You're welcome to question me, Colonel, but never in front of my troops. I’m your friend, but I’m also your superior.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You may have asked for this career, Lieutenant-General, but I’m just a lowly film student serving her time in your “stop gap.”

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: So what, you want to make bullshit romantic comedies to sedate the helpless widows? Rachel looks up at the big map with a hint of sadness.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: Or do you want to save the world?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The motorcycle that 355 and Yorick are riding slows to a next to a pickup truck. The two dismount.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: You ever siphoned before?  4l

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Kind of a personal question, don’t you think? Mind if I ask your name before I start spilling my sexual history? 355 pulls out a small length of rubber hose and goes to w transferring fuel from the truck to her motorcycle.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: You can call me 355.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: “Three Fifty-five?” What is that, some kind of double-oh-seven thing?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: It’s classified. Hearing that word again, Yorick suddenly grows nervous.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: You're not part of the Secret Service, are you?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: We’re a hell of a lot more secret than that.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: I told you, I’m not allowed to... 355 stops herself.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Fuck it. What’s the point, right? My bosses are all dead. Yorick actually looks a little relieved to hear this.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Oh, that’s cool. I mean, it’s not cool, but I was worried you were--

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: 355 was the codename assigned to this country’s first female spy. She was part of General Washington’s Culper Ring during the Revolutionary War.  42

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: So you’re what, one of those re- enactors?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: You wouldn’t have learned this in A.P. History, but Washington never disbanded the Culper Ring. For more than 200 years, we've been secretly working to protect the men and women of this country. Yorick looks at a CORPSE inside one of the nearby vehicle

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: You're doing a bang-up job. 355 spits out gasoline.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: What’s your story?

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: So far? A pretty crappy mystery.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: So you have no clue why you’re the last guy?

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Your guess is as lame as mine. I’m Yorick, by the way. 355 just shoots him a look: “You thought my name was weir

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: My dad teaches... taught drama. I guess he thought naming his kid after an obscure Shakespeare character would help him get tenure. The Culper Ring agent finishes putting away her siphoning gear.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Well, it’s a good thing I found you when I did. You wouldn’t survive another month out there on your own. The Amazon movement is growing, and those women would love nothing more than killing someone like you.  43

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Why? I mean, I can see locking me up, but if those violent femmes offed the last man, wouldn’t they sort of be insuring the death of the fairer sex, too?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: I infiltrated their organization to find out if they had anything to do with whatever caused the global Manslaughter. They’re smart enough to exploit it, but I don’t think they started it. Unfortunately for you, they do have a plan to keep humanity going. 355 jumps back on the refueled bike.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: And it’s strictly no boys allowed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Having finished their work at the Washington Monument, th Daughters of the Amazon have returned to this brightly li peaceful lecture hall, where they’re passing out free Pow Bars to the starving women funneling through the doors. On stage, Victoria is addressing these new recruits while standing next to a large projected image of a human EGG.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Parthenogenesis, the development of an embryo without fertilization by amale. It’s every woman’s dream. The joy of creation without having to endure the most painful part of childbirth... marriage. A few of the hardcores laugh at this, as Victoria changes slide to an image of DR. MANN.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: It’s no longer science fiction thanks to the pioneering work of this woman, bioengineer Dr. Allison Mann. By injecting a single cell into one egg, she could help us give birth to our own twins. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 44 VICTORIA (cont'd) Can you imagine, a society of daughters brought into this world without the poisonous seed of man? We find this woman, and the battle of the sexes is won.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Victoria! Victoria looks out to see Theresa, her bald follower. The girl KNEELS as she enters the room.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Off your knees, Theresa. You know we're all equals here. Dutifully, Theresa rises.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: What happened out there? Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: You have to put out a dragnet, Victoria. I saw one. I... I sawa man. Close on Victoria, suspicious, but not disbelieving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early the next morning, 355 walks her empty motorcycle al a dirt road. A gasmask-clad Yorick is strolling beside he with Ampersand on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: So you're going to Frisco to find this doctor before Mad Maxine does?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: That’s the plan. Hopefully, Dr. Mann will be able to tell us why you and your animal survived, too. Yorick grows nervous.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Um, actually, I kinda have a prior engagement. So to speak. Ampersand and I are headed to Los Angeles to find Beth.  45

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Who the hell is that?

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: A woman I trust more than my own mother. These days, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Yorick, you have a responsibility. We can look for your girlfriend after we see if there’s anything you can do for the human race.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: I appreciate the offer, Three, but I’m not looking for a chaperone. I handled myself just fine out there before you came into the--

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Quiet. Ampersand loudly EEKS as 355 points at a grizzly sight up ahead, THREE SNARLING WOLVES gnawing on the REMAINS of a corpse. As the growling animals approach them, a frightened Yoric casually STEPS BEHIND 355. She quickly dispatches the kil wolves with a WARNING SHOT fired above their heads. A grateful Yorick suddenly looks a little more amenable t the idea of a travelling partner.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Okay, let’s say I did opt to come with you. How are you getting to Cali?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: First, I have to sell our bike. The Plague hit at rush hour out west, so the highways will be too congested with dead guys, even for a motorcycle.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: But, commercial aircraft have all gone the way of boy bands. How are we getting cross country?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: The old-fashioned way.  46 355 and Yorick finally reach a TRAIN YARD, where hundreds American women are lined up like REFUGEES, vying for a sp on board an impossibly long DIESEL TRAIN.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Girls have been trading tampons and vibrator batteries for seats in first class, but these wheels should buy us some room in cargo. The masked Yorick stares at this overgrown train set, una to hide his boyish enthusiasm.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Cool. Push into the bustling crowd, where a FEMALE SCOUT clearl dressed in the garb of the Amazons subtly watches Yorick 355’s every move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later that evening, the packed DIESEL TRAIN chugs out of Maryland. The landscape is peppered with LARGE PIECES OF WRECKAGE from the various passenger jets that crashed in minutes following the Plague. INT. FREIGHT CAR —- CONTINUING Push inside a freight car, which is filled with boxes of CARGO, but only two passengers, 355 and an unmasked Yoric The duo is quietly eating out of cans. Yorick is feeding most of his share to Ampersand.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: I’ve eaten so many canned peaches over the last few months, I think I shat a cobbler last night. Disgusted, 355 sets down her food. Yorick checks out the car’s sparse interior.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: So we’re gonna have to sleep in this thing, huh? Hobo-tastic.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Sorry I couldn’t get us booked in the Four Seasons.  47

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: You know, I actually stayed there one night. After the Plague, right before I left to find my mom. Slept in the presidential suite.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Because I could, I guess. It was mostly sad though. The whole place was packed with homeless women, and they didn’t exactly seem... distraught about the turn of events, you know? Made me wonder if this whole thing happened for a reason. “And the meek shall inherit the earth,” and all that. 355 glares at him, half-joking.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Who’re you calling meek? Ignoring this, Yorick stands and looks out the car’s open door at the unlit scenery passing by.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Man, I have no idea where we’re at now. All these towns look the same in the dark. Is it that hard for you ladies to turn some lights on?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Electricity doesn’t come through the sockets magically, Yorick. It takes a lot of manpower... human- power to operate all of the plants and substations. Energy was a male- dominated industry, but other Culper Ring agents are out there trying to fill the void.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: So you weren’t you the only girl in your... club?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Men held administrative positions, but the Culpers’ undercover agents were all women.  48

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Why go the Charlie’s Angels route? 355 stands to stretch her legs.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Because men can think with their brains or with their penises, but not with both. We have better relationships with our bodies, makes us stronger in the field.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Sure, as long as that field doesn’t contain Mike Tyson.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: We're not always as physically powerful, but there’s a reason the best rock climbers are women. We've got you beat in flexibility, agility, problem-solving.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, I’ve seen this sitcom. You're all great, we suck at everything.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Not everything. You ever been to a nursing home? Notice how it’s ninety percent old women? Same with suicide. We might attempt it more, but you guys usually succeed.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: So what, you’re saying the one thing men are better at than women... is dying? 355 looks out at the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: You’re ahead of us so far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut to the next morning, as a fleet of stolen BLACK HAWK HELICOPTERS flies past the rising sun.  49 INT. BLACK HAWK HELICOPTER —- CONTINUING Cut inside the passenger section of one of these attack choppers, as Alter and Rachel talk to each other over rad headsets. They’re alone here, so Rachel can speak freely.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I’m still not sure how wise it was to steal vehicles from our most loyal ally.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: The U.S. military isn’t an ally, Rachel, it’s a distant memory. All of their brass is dead, and the girls they coddled and refused to let fight are stranded in foreign theaters. Besides, the end justifies the means. The troop transport we used to fly to the States was too slow and unwieldy to keep up with the elusive Mister... Rachel consults her small field notebook.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Brown, Yorick. Our intelligence has nothing on him outside of a social security number and three posts to his old blog. He’s a zilch, Alter. If Yorick’s really the last, God didn’t exactly leave us a Moses, did he?

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: The fact that you still believe in a higher power after all this is charming. Rachel listens to something coming over her headphones.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Scuttlebutt on the ground is that a young man was recently spotted in D.C. But unsubstantiated male sightings are more common than corpses these days, so I continue to question the wisdom of all this.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: My gut says Yorick is alive, Rachel.  50

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Let’s say he is. And let’s say we abduct the Americans’ only son. You realize they’1l go to war to get him back.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: We should be so lucky.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: You saw what happened at the Temple Mount a few months ago, didn’t you? Between our own people? The rioting? The fistfights?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, the ultra-orthodox women interpret the men’s death a little differently than the rest of us.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: The fighting didn’t begin in earnest until the Israeli Defense Forces... sedated our Arab neighbors. As soon as we removed all of Israel’s external threats, the internal conflict that’s been simmering for years finally came to a boil. The helicopter BANKS into the sun.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: The same will happen to our friends in the States soon enough. Without an outside “evil” for its citizens to hate, poor will turn against rich, white against black...

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: What are you suggesting, that the only way to protect peace in our time is to invent a war? What the hell kind of plan is that? Alter smiles a little Mona Lisa grin.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: A very old, very reliable one.  51

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open tight on a sleeping Yorick, who’s JOLTED awake as th stopped train begins to MOVE. He bolts upright, and is relieved to see 355 sitting acro from him with Ampersand on her shoulder. Strangely enough the Culper Ring agent is KNITTING.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: What are you working on? Rifle cozy?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Just keeping my hands busy. The train quickly picks up full speed.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: How long were we stopped?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Few hours. Crew had to remove a herd of dead cows from the tracks.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Bulls.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Sorry?

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: All cows are females. Any dead cattle were probably bulls. 355 scrunches up her nose as she points at Yorick’s shirt

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, speaking of rotting livestock... Yorick sniffs at himself.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Whoof. Sorry. I haven’t changed my shirt since I got to Washington.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: You want to borrow one of mine? Say what you will about the Daughters of the Amazon, but their laundry skills are phenomenal.  52 355 takes a fresh dress shirt out of her bag.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Third time you’ve saved my life, Three-fiddy. Yorick pulls off his dirty T-shirt, and 355 can’t help bu check out his body. Surprisingly, the seemingly scrawny young man actually has a pretty good build. 355 quickly looks away as Yorick starts putting on the new shirt.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Am I having a stroke or are these buttons suddenly on the wrong side?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: It’s a woman’s shirt, Yorick. Deal with it.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Since when are your buttons on the left?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Since buttons were invented? Guys used to carry swords, so the left side of his jacket had to close over the right. So he could draw without his blade getting caught in something? Yorick continues to stupidly fumble with his buttons, and comes over to help him.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Ladies had servants who did their dressing for them, so putting buttons on the left made it easier for them.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: That was then, huh? The two look into each other’s eyes for a moment. They’re only inches apart here. Suddenly, Ampersand (sitting on a crate in the background interrupts this near-romantic moment with his SCREECHING.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Settle, Amp. What’s got you so... 355’s ears perk up, too. Her expression is grave.  53

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: You hear that?

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: The sound of a hundred women’s cycles syncing up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside, the train is now being pursued by DOZENS OF MOTORCYCLES being ridden by the heavily armed DAUGHTERS O THE AMAZON. Victoria is in the pole position, as her troo begin to LEAP off of their bikes and BOARD the moving freighter’s caboose, like a modern-day Great Train Robber

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Victoria and her followers climb inside, this rear car female PASSENGERS scream and clutch their possessions.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: We mean you no harm, sisters! We're simply here to liberate you from the last of your oppressors! INT. FREIGHT CAR —- CONTINUING 355 is looking out her freight car’s open side door as th last of the Amazons board the rear of the train. She pull her head back inside and slides the door closed behind he

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: How bad? 355 pulls a SAWED-OFF SHOTGUN out of her bag, and hands i Yorick.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Depends how many of these crates have ammo in them.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: We're not going to fight them, Three!  54

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: No, I’m gonna hold them for as long as I can while you make a break for the conductor. Tell her to disconnect the engine from the rest of the cars. She gives you any trouble, put that scatter gun to her head.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: But you said it yourself, I can’t make it to California on my own! I need you out there! Push in on 355 as she checks the clip of her HANDGUN.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: This isn’t a democracy, remember? Consider it payback for all the years women weren’t allowed to vote.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I’m big into suffrage. 355 turns to see that Yorick is aiming his shotgun at her head.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Here’s the new plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Daughters of the Amazon are making their way between of the moving train. Theresa (the bald Amazon) takes poin and KICKS open the small door at the rear of Yorick and 3 car. Her fellow Amazons follow her inside... but there’s nothing here but big boxes of freight. Yorick and 355 are nowhere to be seen. The women make their way through the car quickly, with Victoria taking up the rear. As her followers exit, Vic stops dead in her tracks. She looks down and sees a FRESH SLICE of canned peach on the floor of this car. She pulls out her own .357 MAGNUM and looks around, final noticing a CRATE that’s been recently opened, one large enough for two people to hide inside of. Victoria aims her gun at this box as she quickly PRIES op its side.  55 Out come tumbling a dozen CANS OF PEACHES... followed by dozen HUNGRY RATS. They scurry across Victoria's feet.

dialogues.speaker: AHHH
dialogues.text: Embarrassed by her less-than-brave reaction, Victoria loo around to make sure none of her women heard it. Finally, holsters her weapon and prepares to exit the car. But just then, over the rumble of the tracks, Victoria he an unfamiliar sound. She looks around for its source, bef finally staring up at the CEILING of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut onto this car’s ROOF, where 355 and Yorick are hiding Yorick is frantically trying to shut up Ampersand, who's SCREECHING his little head off here.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Exactly who is that thing supposed to be helping? Yorick stuffs the monkey into his backpack.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: It’s not my fault! He’s fucking learning disabled or something!

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Men never were very good teachers. 355 and Yorick spin around to see Victoria standing behin them on this moving train. A trigger-happy Yorick attempt to load a shell into his sawed-off shotgun by FLIPPING it its handle, Terminator 2-style, but sadly, as he spins it the weapon goes FLYING out of his hand and pinwheeling ov the side of the train.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: (to himself) Son of a... 355 is about to draw her weapon, when Victoria warns:

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
