dialogues.text: I don’t have to kill you both, you know. 355 keeps her handgun at her side but chivalrously steps FRONT of a clearly grateful Yorick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. You do.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Theresa tells me you’re not who you said you were, “Catherine.” That's fine. We’re all welcome to remake ourselves in this brave new world. But don’t tell me that you didn’t believe what I had to say. 355 listens silently.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: I looked into your eyes. I saw the way men have hurt you. It’s time to stop protecting our abusers like helpless battered wives. We have to step aside... and let evolution take its course. 56 Slowly, reluctantly, 355 steps aside, leaving Yorick expo not to mention confused.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Uh... Victoria again aims her gun at Yorick.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Thank you, sister. You'll be able to tell your granddaughters that you were there to witness the fall of man.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Truer words. All of a sudden, 355 GRABS Yorick and YANKS him over the of the moving train with her! Pull way out, as the train barrels across a LARGE BRIDGE. 355 and Yorick are just tiny figures here, FALLING a hund feet before finally SPLASHING into a river far below. Victoria watches in disbelief, as Theresa and a few of he fellow Amazons join their leader atop the train.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Victoria, are you...?

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: I'm... I’m fine.  57

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: And the man?

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: (flatly) History. EXT. WOODED AREA —- MAGIC HOUR Cut to later that early evening, as SONIA, an attractive year-old vixen with tattoos and piercings, carries two buckets of water along the bank of a river. Sonia stops in her tracks when she sees AMPERSAND sitting top of a backpack that’s washed up against a stone. She approaches the little capuchin monkey slowly, careful not frighten it.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: Where'd you come from, little guy? Guess they musta opened up the zoos like they opened up our... Sonia DROPS her two pails as she notices something else that’s washed ashore. It’s YORICK, waterlogged and unconscious, but alive.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: Thank you, Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're looking through Yorick’s P.O.V. As he opens his eye a blurry figure looming over him slowly takes shape.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Beth...? Rack focus to reveal that this is actually Sonia.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: Who’s Beth?

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Bah! Yorick sits up to find that he’s in Sonia’s messy bedroom lying in her bed. His clothes are dry now.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: What is this?  58

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: Take it easy.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: My name’s Sonia. I... I found you. With your pet. Ampersand eeks over on Sonia’s dresser.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: Where did you come from, Yorick?

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: How the hell do you know my name? She holds up Yorick’s wallet.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: Your library card. I didn’t even know people still carried--

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Oh my God. 355. Is she...?

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: You mean her? Sonia points across the hall, through the open door to another bedroom, where Agent 355 is sleeping peacefully.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: She's fine. Bit of a bump to the head, but she should be all right. What happened, Yorick? I just found you out there, like Thomas Newton or something. Yorick’s confused.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: The Man Who Fell to Earth?

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Seriously? You a fan of the book or the movie?

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: Both, I guess. Mostly Bowie, to be honest.  59 Yorick’s almost starting to fall for this girl, when he notices Ampersand playing with his RING BOX. Feeling guilty, Yorick gets up to SNATCH it away.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: That's... that’s cool.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: Anyway, we figure you must be some kind of genetic anomaly, like those prostitutes in Africa that are immune to HIV?

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Huh, I hadn't... (backing up) Wait, what do you mean “we?” Sonia walks over to the window of this second-story bedro

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: Yorick, this is a town of sixty- seven gossiping women. Did you really think I could keep something like you a secret? Yorick joins her at the window and looks out to see all S SEVEN WOMEN, a collection of various ages and races (but children), gathered below. They’re looking up at him expectantly. Yorick sighs. INT. BLACK HAWK HELICOPTER —- EVENING Back inside the passenger hold of Alter’s helicopter, she Rachel speak to each other over their headsets.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: We might have a hit, Alter. Sixty clicks due south. Girls in the listening stations back home are reporting a lot of chatter about a twenty-something male washing ashore in a little town called Marrisville.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: Good work. We’ll pay a visit right after we refuel.  60

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Actually, we should probably send as many choppers as we can now.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: Why? You honestly think some undersexed American will be ina hurry to leave an entire village of lonely women?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: That’s not my concern, Lieutenant- General. I’m worried about who these women happen to be... EXT. SONIA’S HOME -- EVENING Back at Sonia’s place, Yorick’s new friend escorts him outside. She introduces him to the town, which stares at this last man with a mixture of disbelief and mistrust.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: Marrisville, this is Yorick. Yorick, this is Marrisville. Yorick waves shyly. NINA, a middle-aged Hispanic woman gives Yorick the once- over.

dialogues.speaker: NINA
dialogues.text: You really the last?

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: I... I don’t know. I think so.

dialogues.speaker: NINA
dialogues.text: Hn. Sonia leads Yorick through the crowd of gawkers.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Is it just me, or are there no kids in this town?

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: Um, I guess I’m the youngest one, yeah. Come on, you want to help me in the hydroponic greenhouse?

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: You have food? Fresh food?  61

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: Sure. Why so surprised?

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: It’s just, almost every post-Plague town I’ve been to has looked like the third act of a Godzilla movie. Yorick looks up at the town’s working street lamps.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: But you guys still have a perfect little utopia.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: I don’t know about that. But we did vote to slaughter one of the lambs for you tonight. And don't feel guilty. Lydia wants us to get rid of them anyway, before the damn flies eat them alive.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Lydia? Suddenly, an elderly white woman steps out of the crowd. This is LYDIA.

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: Hard to believe that helpless little women can get by without your kind, huh?

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: I... I didn’t mean any disrespect.

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: We've all had plenty of experience making do without any men around. Nina steps forward to try to silence Lydia, but the old lady’s on a roll.

dialogues.speaker: NINA
dialogues.text: Lydia...

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: Back in ‘42, the only fellas left in this country were the goddamn 4F- ers tryin’ to get into our overalls. Girls weren't part of the workforce, we were the workforce. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYDIA (cont'd) If none of our boys had come home alive, we coulda run this place just fine on our own... better even.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Back up, you said you all had experience living without men. How? I mean, most of you are a little too young to have been doing the Rosie the Riveter thing, right?

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: Maybe Lydia can explain herself after we fix you some supper. Sonia starts to pull Yorick away, but Nina calls after hi

dialogues.speaker: NINA
dialogues.text: Kid. The black girl up there, she your wife?

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: No! I mean, she’s just a... a friend. But Three’s good people. She's kind of a government agent. But on the downlow, you know? As Sonia and Yorick walk away, Nina and Lydia exchange nervous glances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut to a few minutes later for this establishing shot of impressive greenhouse. Its windows are fogged with condensation, so we can’t quite see inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonia and Yorick enter the well-lit facility, which is fi with fresh flowers and vegetables. They’re alone now.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: So, you and your neighbors all seem pretty... close-knit. Do you mind, can I ask, are you all, not that I care, but...?

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: Some are, but it’d take a hell of a lot more than all the men dying to make me suddenly eat pussy.  63

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Well, you don’t beat around the bush. As it were.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: No. I don’t. Suddenly, Sonia PULLS Yorick close and KISSES him deeply. Yorick pushes her away, but only eventually.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Sonia.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: What? Oh my God. Are... are you gay?

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: What? No! No, not at all.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: Oh. ‘Cause, talk about irony.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: It’s just, there’s someone else.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: But you said your bodyguard-- Yorick pulls out his PHOTO of Beth, which he hands over t Sonia.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: No, my fiancee’s name is Beth. We’re on our way to find her. She's... she’s in Los Angeles.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: It must be hard. Sonia sets aside the photo, and presses herself against Yorick.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: It is. But Yorick gently pulls away from her.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Look, I’m flattered, but for some retarded reason, I was picked to survive all this, so I’m trying not to take advantage of the situation.  64

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: You're not taking advantage of anything, Yorick.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: But I would be. Beth... Beth was my first, you know? She was the only woman alive who wanted me back when I was an unemployed loser. If nothing else, I owe her a little loyalty. Sonia steps forward and runs her fingers through Yorick’s hair.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: I’m sure lots of girls wanted you back then. They just didn’t know how to tell you. Again, she kisses him. Harder this time. The two fall backwards onto one of the greenhouse tables. Sonia is on of Yorick, who’s clearly wrestling with more than just hi conscience.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Please. You... you have to get off.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: (smiling) I’m trying. She kisses him again.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Beth--

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: --will never know. Besides, this isn’t about her. It’s about you helping the planet, and the only way you can do that is by sowing your seed, right?

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: I love her.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: You think JFK didn’t love Jackie? You think MLK didn’t love Coretta? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 65 SONIA (cont'd) Great men fuck around on their wives, Yorick, and whether you like it or not, you’re the greatest man alive now. Sonia writes against Yorick, who's really struggling to b good.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Please...

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yorick? Sonia and Yorick look up to see a relatively recuperated AGENT 355 standing in the doorway of this greenhouse. Ampersand is on her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: You all right? Sonia and Yorick quickly pull themselves apart, like two teens caught making out at Lovers Leap.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: It’s cool. We’re... we’re done here.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: (to Yorick) I’m so sorry. I... I don’t know what came over me, I--

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Yorick, may I borrow you for a second?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 355 drags the embarrassed last man outside. As Yorick finishes buckling his pants, Amp jumps onto his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Look, whatever you saw in there...

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: I don’t care. We have to get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Right now? I mean, this town is a wonderland. We should at least stock up on provisions and--  66

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: These people aren’t what you think, Yorick. They’re--

dialogues.speaker: NINA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: That’s far enough. Cut over to Nina, Lydia and several of the other resident Marrisville. They all have HUNTING RIFLES trained on Yori and 355.

dialogues.speaker: NINA
dialogues.text: I’m afraid we can’t let some spy rat us out to the feds. 355 shoots Yorick a dirty look.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Does the secret in secret agent mean anything to you?

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: What is this? Some kind of militia?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: There’s a women's penitentiary about a mile up the road, Yorick.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: You mean, they’re... they’re convicts?

dialogues.speaker: SONIA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Escaped convicts, technically. Yorick turns just as Sonia walks out of the greenhouse.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: When all the men died, the warden decided to turn us loose... instead of letting us starve to death in our cells. The other women close in on Yorick and 355.

dialogues.speaker: NINA
dialogues.text: The guards lived in the houses we're in now. They took off weeks ago. Guess they couldn’t stand staying where their kin passed.  67

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: None of us wanted to get out like this... but it happened. The other inmates and I all get along pretty well, and we've been taking care of ourselves for years already, so this community just kinda... fell into place.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: What did you do? Murder someone?

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: Robbed a bank. For a guy. Long story. Lydia aims her rifle at Yorick.

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: If you’re looking for a killer, you got one. I shot my bastard of a husband in ‘59 and I don’t regret it for a goddamn second. Sonia walks over to Lydia and pushes her rifle down.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: (to Yorick and 355) Please. We just want to live in peace.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: (to the women) This isn’t my jurisdiction, and we have no intention of telling anyone about your situation.

dialogues.speaker: NINA
dialogues.text: Why should we believe some spook? 355 starts to lose her cool, so it’s Yorick’s turn to pla peacemaker.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: For your sake, I hope you’re talking about my occupation and not my race.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Look, let’s all just... pretend tonight never happened, okay? 355 and I have bigger things to worry about, so we’re just gonna--  68 Suddenly, Yorick is illuminated from directly overhead by burningly bright SPOTLIGHT. He looks up, half-expecting t see a mother ship here to take him home. A WHIRLWIND kicks up dirt and leaves as three BLACK HAWK HELICOPTERS descend into view.

dialogues.speaker: NINA
dialogues.text: It’s a setup!

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: No, I have nothing to do with this! Like the word of God, a familiar voice booms from the hea over one of the chopper’s loudspeakers. It’s Alter.

dialogues.speaker: FROM HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Women of Marrisville, this is not your fight! Hand over the boy, and no one will be harmed! As the helicopters circle to land in a nearby field, a baffled Yorick turns to 355.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Why does everyone keep calling me boy? I'm a college graduate! Nina again swings her rifle in 355’s direction.

dialogues.speaker: NINA
dialogues.text: Whatever, we're not fighting an army. They can take you both for all I care.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: What the hell does the Israeli military want with me?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: If it was anything good, they probably only would have brought one gunship. (to the women) Please. If you hand Yorick over to another country, you people will never know another peaceful day.

dialogues.speaker: NINA
dialogues.text: If we don’t, we'll never know another day period. Sonia suddenly steps in front of Yorick and 355.  69

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: Run. They're probably landing by the orchard, so you’ve still got a few minutes. Take Lewis to Montecito. No street lamps there so you'll have some cover for a getaway.

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: You lost your head, girl? Sonia looks at Yorick with sad eyes.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: We still owe a debt to society, and without someone like him, there might not be another one. 355 nods gratefully before dragging Yorick away from the scene. As he’s being pulled away, Yorick calls after Soni

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Wait! Sonia! Come... come with us! Sonia just watches with regret as the man who fell to Ear disappears into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: Good-bye, Yorick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 355 and Yorick run through the unlit outskirts of this neighborhood. A winded Yorick is falling out of his Chuck Taylors.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Keep up, goddammit!

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: (breathless) Totally... not.. running shoes.. As the two round the corner, they run smack into another Black Hawk helicopter, this one parked in the middle of t street. Three female I.D.F. SOLDIERS all drop their cigarettes an raise their machine guns as they spot Yorick and his bodyguard.  70

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Four gunships?! The youngest Israeli soldier looks for guidance from her older superiors.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG SOLDIER
dialogues.text: (in Hebrew) What... what do we do?

dialogues.speaker: OLDER SOLDIER
dialogues.text: (in Hebrew) We take the male alive, but kill anyone who-- That’s all 355 needs to hear, as she raises her weapon an FIRES it at the two older soldiers, killing them both instantly. Yorick screams in fear and revulsion. 355 aims her Glock at the youngest soldier (she’s frozen terror), and squeezes the trigger. Nothing. The gun’s emp With trembling hands, the young soldier aims her SIDEARM 355.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG SOLDIER
dialogues.text: (in Hebrew) Fuh--freeze! 355 instead TOSSES her own weapon aside and CHARGES direc at the young female soldier. The soldier fires wildly as the screaming Culper Ring age rushes her. 355 eventually TACKLES the soldier, knocking to the ground. The two wrestle over the Israeli’s firearm as the young soldier struggles with what few English phra she remembers.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Let go of the gun! Please!

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Lo! Bevakasha!

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: You don’t have to die!

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Take... take me to my hotel! How much does this cost please! Where is the library! Which train--  71 BANG. Push in close on the two women, as one of them is SHOT.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: (under her breath) Stupid... 355 stands, as the young soldier rattles her last breath. The Culper Ring agent looks over at Yorick, who promptly VOMITS all over his own shoes.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Why... why did you...?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Me or them. Let’s go.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: They were girls! If you’re such a fucking markswoman, couldn’t you have just wounded them or--

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: This isn’t a comic book, Yorick. They knew what they were doing when they filled their hands, and so did I. Now get in the chopper.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Now we're stealing helicopters? No, I... I don’t want anything more to do with this.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: If you had listened to me on the train, we wouldn’t be in this situation! Now do as I fucking say!

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Go on without me, Three. I’m tired of people dying. I’m... I’m just gonna surrender. 355 aims her weapon at Yorick.  72

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: That stopped being your decision the second other countries got involved. Ampersand barks in protest, but Yorick hangs his head. He done fighting. In the distance, a faraway gun battle can be heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonia and her fellow inmates are waging an epic battle against the incoming army, but they’re clearly no match f the Israelis’ numbers. As more and more of them take fire, the surviving townswo eventually lay down their arms and hold up their hands in surrender. Sonia screams in defiance.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: Keep fighting! We can take them! As the shooting dies down, Alter steps out from behind he troops’ frontline.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: Thank you for your attention. The good news is that I have no interest in taking prisoners, so you don’t need to fear another incarceration. Alter pulls out her sidearm and AIMS it at Nina’s head.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: The bad news is that I have no objection to field executions. The rest of the townswomen start to rush to Nina’s defens but the overpowering I.D.F. soldiers back them off.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: Tell me where you’re hiding Yorick Brown or I start putting bullets in brainpans. Sonia drops her rifle and calls out.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: Don’t! He... he ran away!  73 Alter cocks her gun.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: Nonsense, I stationed roadblocks at every possible exit. He-- After consulting with a young female soldier carrying a R PACK, Rachel steps forward to whisper something to Alter.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Alter, North Team is dead. One of our snipers saw their chopper being stolen. She thinks she caught a glimpse of a black woman behind the controls. Alter looks at Rachel in stunned silence for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: (to her troops) Kill them all. Sonia charges forward and all of the I.D.F. Soldiers prom aim their rifles at her.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: Wait! I... I can tell you where he went. He has a girlfriend. In L.A. Beth something. Careful not to make anyone think she’s reaching for a gun Sonia slowly pulls out the PHOTO that Yorick left behind. Alter stares at the picture of this once-happy couple wit interest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several hours later, 355’s stolen Black Hawk soars just a the treetops of Middle America.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut inside the hi-tech vehicle’s cockpit, where 355 is flying. Yorick is in the passenger seat, with Ampersand o his lap.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Yorick, I’m... I’m sorry about back there, okay? I never should have pointed a gun at you.  74

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, guess I opened that door. A nervous Yorick just silently stares out the window as t craft barely skims the foliage.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: I can’t believe you really know how to fly this thing.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: I told you, the Culper Ring trained me well.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: How do you study espionage, exactly? Is there some kind of correspondence school?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: The Ring recruited me out of a foster care facility when I was thirteen, after I put two redneck teenagers in the hospital for calling me names.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Foster care?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: My parents were killed I was six. Yorick suddenly looks guilty.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Don’t be. You weren’t driving the truck that night.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: You know, before all this, I honestly wasn’t sure if your whole undercover sister spiel was legit, or if you were, you know... insane.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Yorick, a mentally ill person wouldn't be able to fly a medium- lift assault helicopter below radar at 250 miles per--  75 Suddenly, the chopper DIPS uncomfortably as one of its extended range fuel tanks accidentally CLIPS a high branc

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Oops. A frightened Yorick looks down at his diaper-clad monkey, yelps.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: (quietly, to Amp) Yeah, I’m gonna need a diaper change, too, buddy. 355 activates a few controls on her dash.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: If you want to help, check that navigation computer and make sure we're on target for San Fran.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: We're still headed to this Attack of the Clones doctor?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: A few refuelings aside, we should be able to fly a straight shot to her lab. It’s more important than ever that we find out why you’re still alive.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Yeah, but what if Victoria and her goons get to Mann’s joint first? We lost some time in Marrisville.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Don’t worry, the trains are about as dependable as they were in pre- Mussolini Italy, remember? We’1l beat her by days. EXT. RAILROAD CROSSING —- MORNING Smash cut to this close-up of a DEAD MALE COWBOY, slumped over the wheel of his pick-up. Pull out to reveal that th unlucky corpse’s truck is parked directly in the middle o RAILROAD TRACKS. BAM! The vehicle is OBLITERATED when a familiar DIESEL TR plows right through it.  76 INT. DIESEL TRAIN ENGINE —- CONTINUING Inside the train’s engine, Victoria is reading to Theresa (the bald Amazon), while an overweight FEMALE CONDUCTOR reluctantly works the train’s throttle.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: “With no aspect of society being at all relevant to women, there remains to civic-minded females only to overthrow the government and destroy the male sex.” Those are the opening words of the SCUM Manifesto, the seminal work of our dear sister Valerie Solanas, a prophet and a--

dialogues.speaker: CONDUCTOR
dialogues.text: Um, ma‘ am? Theresa immediately whips out a CROWBAR, which she uses t threaten the conductor.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: “Ma'am” is short for madam, the mistress who manages a man’s household or the whore who enslaves other women. Which one are you saying Victoria is?

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Let her speak, Theresa.

dialogues.speaker: CONDUCTOR
dialogues.text: I don’t mean to start trouble, m... Victoria, but I’m gonna have to stop at the next station to pick up medical supplies for California.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: That can wait, sister.

dialogues.speaker: CONDUCTOR
dialogues.text: Begging your pardon, but it can’t. If you care about women so much, there are girls with diabetes and whatnot suffering as we speak. Seeing how the shipping lanes died with all the sailor boys, the only way anyone’s gettin’ insulin is-- Victoria puts a hand on the frightened woman's back.  77

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Nothing is more resilient or resourceful than womankind. I’m confident our sisters will make do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut to later that night, where HUNDREDS OF WOMEN are gath outside a makeshift triage center in downtown Los Angeles All of these Angelenos are helping one another, there are pockets of violence. It’s a welcome bit of peace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Push inside, where Yorick’s long lost girlfriend BETH DEV is sitting at a round table, leading a diverse group of FEMALE COMMUNITY LEADERS in a meeting. She turns her attention to a young Asian woman named CHLOE.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: All right, so Fara is taking care of Meals on Wheels outside the valley. Chloe, what’s our postal situation?

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: A step above Pony Express, but a far cry from UPS. Still, not bad considering the only thing mailmen are carrying these days is disease.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Speaking of which, how are we on antibiotics, Nora? Beth turns to NORA, a sixty-something pharmacist.

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: Unless you're in the market for six crates of Viagra, I’m dangerously low on every drug in the-- Suddenly, the sound of HELICOPTERS is heard outside. The women all race to a nearby window, where they see Black H approaching. Chloe and Nora are immediately excited.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Is that military? Oh, God, are they finally dropping supplies?  78

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: Behold, the angels storm the gates of hell. Push in on Beth, the only one who looks nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On cue, jump to Las Vegas, as its entire gaudy skyline BU in a spectacular inferno. EXT. LAS VEGAS’S MCCARRAN AIRPORT - CONTINUING Cut over to the airport across the highway, where Yorick 355 calmly watch this conflagration. Their grounded helicopter is REFUELING next to a tanker truck at the Veg airport. Ampersand is playing on the hose connected to th Black Hawk.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: This is men’s fault, too, right? Because we taught our daughters to be showgirls instead of firemen?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Firefighters. Yorick is fed up.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: You know, I’m not the He-Man Woman- Hater you think I am. I didn’t roadie for Lilith Fair or anything, but I’m down with the cause. I rarely make sexist jokes, always hold doors open for ladies... Suddenly, 355 gets into a SPARRING position.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: I mean, I never hold doors open?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: I’m not always going to be around to protect you, Yorick. But the S.U.V. of the sky here needs another ten to finish gassing up, so I figured I might as well teach you a little self-defense. Yorick waves her off.  79

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: I’ve gotten myself out of plenty of scrapes before, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: In what, Double Dragon?

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Double Dragon? What are you, forty? 355 playfully flicks him the finger.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Like many a high school nerd, I survived bullies in the tried and true fashion of fighting like a girl.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Which means what exactly?

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Scratching eyes, pulling hair, kicking balls. Not that the last one is so applicable anymore...

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Why not just go to the gym?

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: What’s the point? You know what the strongest muscle in the human body is?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: The heart?

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: No, it’s not the heart, you sappy fuck. It’s your jaw muscle. Even a scrawny dude like me has five hundred pounds of bite strength.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Great, that’1l come in handy when you're fighting food. As the helicopter continues to refuel, the two sit down o its edge and watch the fires continue to rage in the distance. Ampersand scampers over to sit on Yorick’s lap.  80

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Hey, before all this, did you, you know? Have somebody?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Not for a while. My relationships always ended bad.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Because of your job? 355 takes a deep breath. She softens a bit.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Because men are all cheating bastards.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Oh. Hey, look, what happened with Sonia...

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Relax. You’ve got to be the only guy on the planet who’d end up in this position and not try to bang everything that moves.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I scored someone way above my pay grade. A wave of sadness suddenly washes over Yorick. 355 recognizes it and reaches out to touch his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Beth is still out there, Yorick. You’1l find her soon and she’1l be fine.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: I don’t. I’m just saying whatever shit will get you to stop moping. A smiling Yorick sets Ampersand down and stands into spar position.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Okay, show me what you got, killer.  81 355 rises to meet him.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Your funeral. The two playfully throw punches while black smoke continu to billow into the Vegas sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later that night, Victoria and her fellow Daughters of th Amazon exit their train. Theresa looks concerned.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Last stop, Victoria, and Dr. Mann's laboratory is gonna take at least another ten hours to reach on foot.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Why the hell would we travel on foot, Theresa?

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Well, bikes are pretty much nonexistent after we lost ours boarding this thing, and the highways are too clogged with makeshift hearses for us to all pile into a Greyhound or whatever. Walking along the tracks, Victoria approaches a LIVESTOCK CAR.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Do you know what the Girl Scout motto is? Victoria stops in front of a car filled with a dozen youn female HORSES.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Same as the Boy Scouts’. EXT. DR. MANN’S LABORATORY - NIGHT Hours later, 355’s helicopter LANDS in the empty parking just outside of Mann’s modest laboratory in San Francisco Push in on the craft, as Yorick (with Ampersand on his shoulder) exits the helicopter with Agent 355. They inspe the darkened lab.  82

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Abandoned?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Maybe. I’11 look around. You and your animal stay here.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: And let you inspect the mad scientist’s haunted laboratory all by yourself? If you insist... Ampersand chirps as 355 walks into the black building. INT. DR. MANN’S LABORATORY -- CONTINUING 355 steps inside the eerily quiet building and draws her sidearm, just in case.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Hello? Just then, she hears something SNAP behind a door to her left. Slowly, 355 turns its knob and pushes her way inside. A small GENERATOR is whirring away quietly as it powers numerous COMPUTER TERMINALS, ELECTRON MICROSCOPES, etc.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Dr. Mann? Dr. Allison M-- Suddenly, a figure steps out from behind the door and pre a HYPODERMIC NEEDLE millimeters away from a frozen 355's neck. It’s DR. MANN.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: There are enough sedatives in this syringe to put a woman twice your size to sleep for a month.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: I’m not here to hurt you, Doctor.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: The Black Hawk you parked in the handicap spot suggests otherwise.  83

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: I’m here to protect you. I’m Agent

dialogues.speaker: 355, I--
dialogues.text: A terrified Mann immediately BACKS AWAY from her hostage.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: You work for the Culper Ring? With lightning speed, 355 reaches up and GRABS Mann’s wri snatching the hypodermic away from her.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: How the hell do you know about the Culpers? Dr. Mann takes a seat in one of her lab chairs, exhausted

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: You're the people responsible for all this.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: (a beat) What?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: “Project: Setting Son” or whatever you monsters called it. A disbelieving 355 aims her Glock at the doctor.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: Please, if you’re going to kill me, just do it, but spare me the feigned ignorance.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Doctor, look at me. I have no idea what this is all about. I’m here to protect you from... from people who want to use you.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: Like your superiors did?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Which superiors?  84

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: You're serious? The Culper men honestly kept their foot soldiers in the dark about their real plans? 355 lowers her gun and sits down across from Mann, ready listen.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: Your “ring” was terrified of the possibility of our country eventually having to fight a ground war with the Chinese military. So aman named 1033 ("Ten-thirty- three”) apparently began considering the possibility of a preemptive biological strike.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: How... how do you know all this?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: Because Ten told me. He came here once a week, offered me millions in exchange for helping to make his sick vision a reality.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: His vision?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: Discretely releasing a chemical agent into Beijing’s air supply, one that wouldn’t harm civilians... but would prevent its women from conceiving male children. His hope was that it could be used to effectively cripple China’s economic and military capabilities within a generation.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Someone from the Culper Ring did this? That's... that’s impossible.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: If only. I refused to have anything to do with Ten’s tests, but he and his team proceeded to the experimental stage without me.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: What happened?  85

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: What always happens when man tries to fuck with Mother Nature. Dr. Mann stands and looks out her window at nothing in particular.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: I knew the second I read their preliminary research that the environmental impact of even an isolated test would be severe... but I had no idea it would be this.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: But, how did it spread so quickly?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: Morphogenetic fields? Trade winds? Migrating flocks? Your guess is as good as mine. All I know is that there doesn’t seem to be one corner of the globe that wasn’t affected.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Can it be reversed?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: I can’t raise the dead, Agent.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: But, can you bring mankind back to the planet?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: The Plague destroyed every last sperm, fetus and fully developed mammal with a Y chromosome. And whatever was released into the atmosphere is still there. I've attempted to make new XY rats by using the cells of dead subjects, but they all end up suffering the same fate as their late brethren. I'm afraid a living male will never again set foot on this planet.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Then this is one small step for man... 355 and Dr. Mann turn to see YORICK walk inside the room. Ampersand is on his shoulder, as always.  86

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Etcetera, etcetera. Mann’s jaw goes slack.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: Oh... oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: I get that a lot. Much to Yorick’s surprise, the doctor rushes over to insp Ampersand.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: The size of those canines. Is this monkey a male?

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah. Actually, I’m also--

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: Obviously. I could understand one of you being some kind of mutation, but how did you both survive?

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Doc, the last time I delved into science on my own, it involved a baking soda volcano nearly blowing off one of my testicles. I was kinda hoping you had some answers.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: Where did you find this creature? Mann takes Ampersand from Yorick, but the animal LEAPS ou her hands and starts playing with one of the nearby TEST TUBES.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Online, at this volunteer group’s website. But maybe Ampersand... I don’t know, escaped from some Area 51 research facility first. He certainly seems at home here. Mann inspects Ampersand’s fur.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: He’s not tagged with any lab markings. I'11 need to take a blood sample. From both of you.  87 355 is lost in her own world, still processing her group’ unforgivable betrayal.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: I... I dedicated my life to those men.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, Three, but we gotta save the existential crises for later, right? (to Mann) Do whatever you need to get started, Doc, but there’s a crazy train blowing into town with your name on it, so we should really be out of here by morning. Mann ominously pulls on a single RUBBER GLOVE.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: We'll leave when I’m good and ready. Last man or not, it’s going to take more than the apocalypse for me to start taking orders from my patients.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back in Los Angeles, Beth leads the other local women outside, as the Black Hawks make a dramatic landing. ALTER steps out of the first chopper, and immediately approaches Beth.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: Beth Deville. Your reputation precedes you.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: You're not Americans, are you? Who the hell are you peop-- Before Beth can say another word, someone comes up behind and places an ETHER-SOAKED RAG over her mouth. As she sli into unconsciousness, Beth falls back into the arms of RACHEL, Alter’s second-in-command. Beth’s friends scream in horror and race to help their colleague, but the Israeli soldiers back them away with t machine guns, while Rachel and Alter carry the sleeping B into their copter.  88

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: What now? We just take up position here and wait for the boy to come to us?

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: No, young Mr. Brown and his mystery associate have already killed three of our soldiers and stolen one of our ships. He’s obviously not a threat to be taken lightly. We need a more fortified staging area if we’re going to take him alive. Rachel considers this.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Have you seen Citizen Kane? Alter just stares at her blankly. INT. DR. MANN’S LABORATORY - NIGHT Open on an image of Y-SHAPED PROTEINS as seen through an incredibly powerful microscope.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It’s about sex. Pull out, as Mann looks up from her work.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: Like everything, it’s about sex. 355 and Yorick are confused.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Uh...

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: A foreign agent was introduced into your animal’s bloodstream, and his immune system produced unique antibodies to fight it. Somehow, these antibodies had the added side effect of masking him from the effects of the Plague.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: How'd this “foreign agent” end up inside a monkey?  89

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: It appears to travel through the body much like syphilis or hepatitis, so my guess is that it was sexually transmitted.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: But... how did it get inside me? 355 and Dr. Mann just stare at Yorick and Ampersand.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Okay, that’s just sick. I did not blow my monkey!

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: Well, did it ever bite you deeply enough to draw blood?

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: No, the only person he ever bit was... The truth slowly dawns on Yorick.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Beth. JI fucked Beth. 355 and Dr. Mann just look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Look, I had sex with my girlfriend, and Ampersand bit her. Whatever mojo saved the two of us must have come from Beth.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: How’s that possible? How is she connected with the Culper Ring?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: She’s not. I don’t think this antidote was created deliberately. It’s another moldy Petri dish that turns out to be penicillin.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Beth isn’t mildew, she’s a genius.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: I don’t care about her mind, I care about her body. What made her special? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 90 DR. MANN (cont'd) Was she ever diagnosed with a rare blood disorder? Polycythemia vera or Immune Thrombocytopenic Purpura or--

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Her shot. Beth’s been testing some kind of... of injectable contraceptive on herself.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: Then she might be the greatest failure in the history of science... because her “birth control” could very well be the key to repopulating the entire planet. As this slowly sinks in, a vindicated Yorick celebrates.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: I knew it! I knew we should have been looking for Beth all along!

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Doctor, can you replicate the antibodies inside Yorick and Ampersand?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: Maybe, but I need to know exactly what triggered their creation before I can retro-engineer an inoculation.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Then we have to get to Los Angeles fast, before Beth-- Suddenly, a SQUAWKING is heard coming from outside Mann's laboratory window. 355 draws her weapon.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: The hell is that?

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Sounds like it’s coming from our copter. EXT. DR. MANN’S LABORATORY - CONTINUING 355 warily escorts her companions outside, as Yorick note flashing light on the helicopter’s cockpit.  91

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: We have a radio?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Don't touch it, Yorick. Just--

dialogues.speaker: FROM RADIO
dialogues.text: I repeat, this message is for Yorick Brown. You have until midnight to surrender yourself to us at the Hearst Castle in San Simeon. If you don’t, we will be forced to terminate your loved one. The blood drains out of Yorick’s face as his GIRLFRIEND’S VOICE comes over the speaker.

dialogues.speaker: FROM RADIO
dialogues.text: You people are insane! My boyfriend is dead! Yorick is dead! Change angles so that we’re now looking at Yorick through familiar P.O.V. of a pair of BINOCULARS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reverse angles to reveal that these field glasses belong Victoria, who’s standing at the top of a nearby San Franc hill, in front of her assembled troops, most of whom are mounted on HORSEBACK. Victoria lowers the binoculars to speak with Theresa, her bald-headed second-in-command.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: I don’t suppose that’s his clone?

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Where the hell did they get a helicopter?

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: I have no idea, but we’re not letting him steal the good doctor for himself. Bring me Sam.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Are you sure? Victoria just glares at Theresa, who quickly summons TWO AMAZON RECRUITS carrying a LONG CRATE.  92

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Sorry, just thought we were saving her to use on Mount Rushmore. Victoria opens this box...

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: The best laid plans of mice and men... ...revealing that “Sam” is actually a SURFACE TO AIR MISS LAUNCHER. EXT. DR. MANN’S LABORATORY - NIGHT Cut back to Yorick and the others, outside the helicopter still debating what to do about Beth.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: We have to tell these people what they have. This Beth girl is the Holy Grail!

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Somehow, I don’t think that’s going to make the Israelis more likely to part with her.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Then I have to give myself up.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: No. If they take you, it’s going to destabilize the entire world.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Like it’s not destabilized already? What difference is one less guy gonna make to the-- Just then, Yorick and the others are violently THROWN to ground, as the entire tail section of the Black Hawk EXPL after being struck by a S.A.M. missile. 355 groggily gets to her feet, and looks up to see a STAM of mounted Amazons charging down a hill in the background

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: What?  93 355 yells at a temporarily deafened Yorick, who's holding terrified pet monkey.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: We have to get out of here!

dialogues.speaker: WHAT
dialogues.text: An impatient 355 helps a disoriented Dr. Mann to her feet

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Do you have a car?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: (sheepishly) Sort of.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open tight on a “Y” logo, and pull out to reveal that it’ attached to the front of a 1990 YUGO CONVERTIBLE. Yorick and his companions race for this tiny vehicle, whi is parked in the narrow alleyway behind Mann's lab.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: A Yugo?!

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: Hey, don’t blame me for this country’s pathetic funding of the sciences! 355 throws her duffel bag into the passenger seat.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Mann, you drive. Yorick, get in the back and keep your head down. 355 pulls out a PUMP-ACTION MOSSBERG.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: I got shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside the alley, the car soon SCREECHES around the corn  94 The vehicle dodges several larger cars still parked in th middle of the street (leftover victims of the Plague), as Mann & Co. are immediately confronted by the oncoming pos of horse-riding Daughters of the Amazons.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me? The car’s hood is soon PEPPERED with shots fired from the rifle-toting Amazons. 355 leans out of the convertible an RETURNS FIRE.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: Don’t shoot the horses!

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Don’t you experiment on animals for a living?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: You kill a horse, I’11l drive us into a lamppost! 355 shakes her head as she SHOOTS another girl, careful n to hit any of the mares. The Yugo FLIES past Victoria, who circles around to GIVE CHASE to the slow-moving car.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: We want the doctor alive! Save your bullets for the boy! Inside the car, Yorick sticks his head up from the back s

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: What’s this thing’s top speed, eleven?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: It’s a goddamn obstacle course! I'm doing my best! 355 turns around and angrily PUSHES Yorick back down, as FIRES a shot over his head.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Do better! If we can’t shake them by San Simeon, we'll have two sides going to war over Yorick! Suddenly realizing what she’s just said, 355 lowers her g to look down at Yorick, whose expression is equally knowi  95

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to this ridiculously palatial estate overlooking Pacific Ocean, a shrine to man’s self-indulgence. Alter’s troops are at the ready outside, guns drawn in fr of their two parked helicopters, while the third chopper circles directly above this modern-day Xanadu. INT. HEARST’S PRIVATE SUITE - CONTINUING Inside Mr. Hearst's private suite, a room filled with an obscene amount of MIRRORS, Beth is TIED to an ornately ca chair. She screams against her gag, and the muffled cries for help echo throughout this massive room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just outside Beth’s makeshift prison, Alter and Rachel ar surveying troop movements from the castle’s GRAND BALCONY

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Yorick’s not coming for her, Alter. He could have any woman he wanted!

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: So could Menelaus, and he still launched a thousand ships to retrieve Helen of Troy. Trust me, there’s only one thing a man wants. Alter points at an APPROACHING VEHICLE kicking up dust in distance.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: The woman he can’t have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut inside this approaching vehicle, as a nervous Mann chauffeurs 355 and Yorick towards certain doom.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: How sure are you about this plan? Yorick and 355 speak over each other.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Forty percent. Ten percent.  96 Dr. Mann just sighs, as Yorick reaches back to pull up th vehicle’s CONVERTIBLE TOP.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: That’s a combined fifty percent, baby. Even odds we live through this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car SKIDS to an impressive halt, and the female I.D.F Soldiers cautiously approach it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel inspects the car through BINOCULARS, as Alter give orders over a BULLHORN.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: He’s not alone. Looks like at least two others in there, but snipers won’t be able to get a clear shot at them while the top is up. A Trojan Horse?

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: (through bullhorn) Hold your fire until the target is out of the vehicle! Approach with caution and--

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Ah, Alter? An annoyed Alter lowers her megaphone.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: What now?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Forget the horse... they brought the fucking cavalry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut back outside, as VICTORIA leads her mounted troops thundering up the castle’s main driveway. Theresa looks up to see the Israelis’ helicopter, and rid up alongside her leader.  97

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Victoria, what is this?

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Endgame. Victoria and her heavily armed troops come to a stop on o side of the parked Yugo, as the confused I.D.F. troops sq off against them on the other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back inside the vehicle, the trio nervously watches this showdown.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: We're dead.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: No, the Amazons won't risk hurting you, and the Israelis want Yorick alive. They’re not going to be shooting at us.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Yeah, haven’t you ever seen two girls go at it over a guy, Doc? After the first slap, they forget he ever existed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Victoria’s followers keep their weapons trained on the opposing army, the Amazon leader addresses the Israelis.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Sisters, your animal instincts tell you to shelter this boy, but ask yourselves, are you animals or are you women? Why give your lives to defend some testosterone-drunk predator?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alter and Rachel are still on their high-ground perch overlooking this face-off.  98

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: They're not with the boy, they’re against him.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: The enemy of our enemy...?

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: Is still our fucking enemy. Alter picks up a small handheld radio.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: Air team, take them out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut to the Israelis’ one airborne helicopter, as it circl above the mounted Daughters of the Amazon and UNLEASHES a thousand rounds of ammunition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As her mounted warriors take heavy fire, Victoria barks o orders.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Kill them all, let the Goddess sort them out! Theresa again produces the S.A.M. Launcher, which she FIR at the helicopter above. Its main rotor EXPLODES and the helpless craft spirals towards oblivion, ultimately CRASH on top of several I.D.F. ground troops. The Amazons cheer, but the surviving Israelis quickly res their firefight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the two armies otherwise occupied, 355 gathers her weapons and reaches for the passenger-side door.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: All right, I’m gonna make a break around back and try to find Beth. As long as these assholes don’t run out of bullets, you two should be safe in here.  99

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Three...

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Doctor, if I’m not back in five, peel the hell out of here and do what you can with Yorick.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Three!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yorick calls after her, but 355 is already gone. As she dodges the crossfire, 355 DIVES for a row of hedges on th sidelines of this battle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back inside the tiny car, Ampersand LEAPS out of Yorick’s arms and goes running out the car’s window after 355.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Goddammit, Ampersand! Get back-- Yorick starts to open his door, but quickly closes it as HAIL OF GUNFIRE kicks up dirt just outside the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the rear of the sprawling estate, 355 carefully lurks around a maze of crumbling old marble columns. She accidentally brushes past a loose fragment of one of thes pillars, which falls to the ground with a not insignifica CHUNK. Nearby, the TWO LONE I.D.F. GIRLS entrusted with guarding this rear entrance turn their machine guns in the directi of this sound. An outgunned 355 steadies her SILENCED PIS and takes a breath, preparing to confront these women. Just then, a SCREECHING is heard, and the two soldiers pi to see Ampersand hissing at them from another column in t background. Before this bizarre sight has time to sink in with the tw soldiers, 355 takes advantage of the distraction to SHOOT women dead. 355 looks at the capuchin monkey with a hint gratitude.  100

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: (under her breath) You're finally good for som-- Unfortunately, Ampersand proves to be just as useless as ever, as his noises apparently attracted the attention of THIRD GUARD, one who promptly SHOOTS 355. The bullet enters high in her left collarbone, just above heart, with enough force to KNOCK 355 backwards. Before s falls, 355 squeezes off a single round, HITTING her attac square in the eye. COLLAPSING to the ground, 355 fights to maintain consciousness, but her eyes start to roll back into her h Ampersand watches all this with seeming indifference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back at the main battlezone, Victoria again rallies her followers.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Hold your ground, sisters! Give me cover while I retrieve our savior! Still on horseback, Victoria’s mare GALLOPS into the fray The Amazon dismounts when she reaches Yorick’s vehicle. She promptly RIPS OPEN the Yugo’s driver-side door.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Dr. Mann, I presume. Victoria starts PULLING Mann out of the car, but Yorick i holding onto the doctor’s feet.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Don’t struggle, you belong with me.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: (struggling) I only... date... sane chicks! Mann pulls out the same HYPODERMIC she threatened 355 wit and PLUNGES it into Victoria’s arm. The Amazon leader loo at this needle with confusion before finally COLLAPSING, while Yorick PULLS Mann back inside the car.  101

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back on the balcony, Rachel watches the battle with disgu

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: By the time we kill the last of these maniacs, they’1l have wiped out half our platoon. We have to stop this! Cut over to Alter, as she opens a crate of GAS GRENADES.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: I concur.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Fentanyl? No, the gas is too unpredictable. When the Russians used it on those Chechen women--

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: Yorick’s a virile young man. It won't kill him.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: But if the wind carries a strong enough concentration our girls’ way, they could be paralyzed or worse. We have to call them back first!

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: Retreat? And risk letting those savages escape with our prize? Push in on Alter, as she begins loading a grenade into a large RIOT GUN.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: I'm afraid that’s not an option. Cut back to Rachel, as she reluctantly DRAWS her sidearm aims it at her superior.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Put it down, Lieutenant-General. Alter slowly lowers the riot gun.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: You remember the punishment for treason, I trust?  102

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I should have done this back in Tel Aviv. You’re a disgrace to our country and our-- With a flick of the wrist, Alter produces a DAGGER WITH A PEARL HANDLE. She steps forward and quickly PLUNGES it in Rachel’s heart. She stares into the girl’s eyes as Rachel’s pupils become still and black.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: I forgive you. As Rachel’s lifeless body crumbles to the balcony floor, Alter picks up her riot gun and LAUNCHES several grenades down at the ongoing battle below. Push past Alter into a close-up of Beth, still hostage in room behind her. The gagged girl has been watching this entire act of barbarism. Her eyes flash both fear and rag

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the fentanyl gas grenades IMPACT against the battlefie I.D.F. soldiers immediately drop their weapons and KEEL O The Amazons soon follow suit, as their horses struggle to stay upright before finally COLLAPSING, pinning the equal unconscious female warriors under their heavy bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the vehicle, Mann watches this shocking display of chemical warfare with terror. A panicking Yorick fumbles for the little car’s buttons.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: The windows! But a frantic Mann quickly opens her door and starts to c outside.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: No, the vents will let it all in anyway! We have to get outside! Get low! Get...  103 Push in on an instantly unconscious Mann, as she promptly falls FACE FIRST onto the hard earth. INT. HEARST’S PRIVATE SUITE - CONTINUING Beth shudders as someone PULLS OFF her cloth gag. She loo up to see Alter standing over her.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: It’s over now. Beth promptly SPITS in Alter’s face.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: You're a fucking Nazi. After a nerve-wracking beat, Alter just calmly wipes her with Beth’s gag.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: If you want to live to see your boyfriend, I'd advise against comparing me to the scum that slaughtered my grandfather.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: If the jackboot fits.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: Your hatred is unjustified...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alter’s words continue over images of the gas cloud swirl around the still bodies on the battlefield below.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: .+-your true love is only sleeping. Push in on Yorick’s body. He’s lying down on his stomach just outside of the car.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Dreaming of you, no doubt. But suddenly, Yorick’s body begins to MOVE. Track over to his face, which we can now see is wearing the familiar GA MASK Yorick’s been carrying with him since New York!  104

dialogues.speaker: ALTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The boy will be fine in a few hours. The gasmask-clad Yorick looks around to make sure that no is watching, before he reaches for one of the fallen Amaz REVOLVERS. He picks it up, and triumphantly RISES.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And he’1l wake in a much safer world. Walking into the noxious fog that still lingers over the grounds, Yorick DISAPPEARS. INT. HEARST’S PRIVATE SUITE - CONTINUING Smash cut back to a disbelieving Beth.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you? Alter turns her back on the girl and starts to walk out o the room.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: Alter Tse’elon. Beth calls after her.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Isn’t that a guy’s name? Alter stops in her tracks. She turns to look back at Beth

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: Don’t tell me Yorick found himself a nice Jewish girl. But only half, no? Your mother must have found herself a nice Aryan to settle down with.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Alter. It means “old one,” right? Alter approaches her.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: A stupid tradition. Two of my siblings died at birth, so when my parents had me, they decided never to speak my real name aloud. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 105 ALTER (cont'd) The nickname is meant to deceive the Angel of Death, so that he’1ll never be able to find me. Beth just sneers.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Today's the day he catches up with you. A sinisterly smiling Alter gets close to the girl’s face.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: Really? Have you guessed my true name?

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yeah. It starts with “C” and rhymes with “cunt.” Cut over to the gun-wielding YORICK, as he dramatically r off his gasmask with his free hand.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: He confidently aims his weapon at Alter, but she immediat steps behind the still-bound Beth, and presses her pearl- handled DAGGER against the stunned girl’s throat.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: Drop it before I open her. Yorick looks at the revolver in his trembling hand. There are only TWO BULLETS in its chambers. What if he misses? Reluctantly, Yorick lowers the weapon.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, Beth.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Yorick, it’s fine! Go, get out of here!

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: No, not just about this. I’m... I’m sorry about before. I lied to you. Beth is confused, but Alter’s just impatient.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: What?  106

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: This is not fucking couples therapy!

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: I told you I got Ampersand because I wanted to help people, but really, I just wanted to impress you.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Yorick, leave!

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: I love you, Beth, but everything I’ve ever done, I’ve done for myself. I don’t know why fate chose a selfish bastard like me, but she made a huge mistake.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: If you want to help your girl, why the hell are you still talking?

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Because, men are only better than women at one thing. Alter can’t resist.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: And what might that be?

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: This. Suddenly, Yorick SPINS his revolver’s open wheel, before slamming it shut... and PRESSING THE GUN TO HIS OWN TEMPL He closes his eyes and plays his first round of Russian Roulette. CLICK.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: I’m useless to you dead, right? Let her go, or I punch my own ticket.  107

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: You're lying. That gun’s even not loaded. You’d never-- Yorick interrupts her by FIRING a shot into the marble fl Beth and Alter flinch in shock, as Yorick again SPINS the wheel and takes aim at his own skull.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: All it takes is one, right? Push in close on the gun, as we see the one remaining bul start to move into position behind the revolver’s slowly descending hammer.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: No! Just as Yorick’s about to squeeze the trigger, Alter THRO her pearl-handled dagger at his WRIST! As the dagger EMBEDS itself just below Yorick’s hand, the last man DROPS his weapon before it discharges. Alter RUNS for the fallen weapon, but Yorick KICKS it awa before she can get her hands on it. As Alter cautiously approaches him, Yorick YANKS the dagg out of his wrist. He’s trying to look like a badass as he wields the blade, but the pain is unbearable.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: AHH! Holy shit did that hurt! As Yorick continues to brandish the dagger, Alter suddenl CHARGES at him.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: You've never even met pain. Alter KICKS the knife out of Yorick’s hand before ferocio HEAD-BUTTING him between the eyes. As a stunned Yorick falls backwards, Alter calmly picks u her dagger, tucks it into her belt, and heads for the revolver. But just as she’s about to reach this gun, Yori catches a second wind and DIVES for it. The two violently WRESTLE over the weapon... until a SHOT finally rings out Yorick smiles. This is just like what happened with 355 a the Israeli soldier back in Marrisville, right?  108 Wrong. A horrified Alter looks down to see the smoking weapon in her hand... and a smoldering hole in Yorick's shirt, just to the left of his belly button. Yorick slumps to the ground, and Beth is too shocked to scream.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: (under her breath) No... A worried Alter stumbles back to Beth. The solider DRAWS blood-stained dagger. Beth flinches, but Alter just SLICE her free of her restraints. She points at the fallen Yori

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: I'm... I’m not a medic, I’m just Asee A furious Alter glares at the girl.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: I‘1l need your knife. More glaring.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: To cut his clothes. Alter reluctantly flips the pearl-handled blade around an hands it to Beth, but not before she AIMS Yorick’s sidear her, and takes a defensive position near the room’s one doorway.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: Don’t fuck up. Beth runs over to Yorick, quickly kneeling at his side. S brushes his hair affectionately before she tears into his shirt with her knife.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: (smiling, playfully sarcastic) My knight in shining armor.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Right, more like... your damsel in distress.  109 As Beth goes to work, Yorick whispers to her:

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Listen to me. Don’t worry about Alter. That gun... is empty now. You have... to let me die.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Don’t talk like that.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: The world’s... safer without me. Just-— Alter angrily aims her gun at the young lovers.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: STOP FUCKING TALKING! One more word out of either of you, and... Just then, Alter notices something in one of the suite’s MIRRORS. A figure has silently entered the room behind he It’s Agent 355, badly wounded, but alive. Just as 355 is about to put a silenced bullet in Alter’s head, the Israeli general spins around and KNOCKS the gun of her hand.

dialogues.speaker: AHN
dialogues.text: Yorick is both excited and frightened to see his friend.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Three! Alter then KICKS 355 in the stomach, sending the secret a flying out of the room. Alter runs out after her. Back in the suite, Beth is more confused than ever.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Who the hell is that?

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: (groggy) It’s... a long... And with that, Yorick slips into unconsciousness.  110

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the opulent north wing just outside this suite, Alter continues to battle Agent 355. 355 flicks open her BATON, which she SMASHES against Alte right hand, causing her to drop her gun. Alter then ROUND HOUSES the baton away from 355. It’s strictly hand-to-hand and woman-to-woman from here u the end. 355 taunts Alter, as she deftly uses her one goo arm to violently SPAR with her opponent.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: You're the one who killed my girls? Back in Marrisville?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: If anyone got them killed, it’s you. Alter charges forward and digs her THUMB into 355’s bulle wound.

dialogues.speaker: NAHH
dialogues.text: 355 tries to PUNCH Alter in the kidneys, but the Lieutena General dodges the attack and uses 355’s momentum against her, THROWING her over a nearby railing. 355 lands on her back with a sickening THUD. Alter looks down at her, and, without pity, proceeds to V over the railing and POUNCE on 355’s one good arm, SNAPPI it loudly. 355 screams, as Alter uses that same broken right arm to painfully DRAG the Culper Ring agent back up the stairs. the landing, Alter then climbs ON TOP of the pained woman

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: Who? Who do you work for? 355 says nothing, so Alter PUNCHES her in the face as har she can. Through bloody teeth, 355 spits out:

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: The... the Culper Ring. Alter smiles.  111

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: You're joking. I thought your little sewing circle was just a myth the drill instructors used to scare us at boot camp. They told us you were the best of the best. Alter PUNCHES 355 again.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: Tell me, what number did your keepers give you? Maybe I’1l get it tattooed on my ass. A winded 355 struggles to whisper something inaudible.

dialogues.speaker: ALTER
dialogues.text: Speak up, girl. Alter leans in close, as 355 echoes Yorick’s earlier word her.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: (whispering) You know what the strongest muscle is? Before Alter can answer, 355 SNAPS her jaws around Alter’ throat, and BITES DOWN as hard as she can. Alter howls a hideous, gurgling scream, as 355 TEARS OFF healthy chunk of her neck. Stumbling away from her defenseless opponent, Alter press palm against her own neck to try to stem the horrible tid pouring out of her opened jugular. With her free hand, Alter reaches down to pick up the GUN knocked away earlier. She raises her shaky hand to fire a fatal round down into her opponent's face. 355 squeezes her eyes shut, bracing herself for impact... when she hears an unfamiliar SHUNK noise. The Culper Ring agent opens her eyes just in time to watc Alter fall forward, DEAD. Sticking out of her back is the pearl-handled dagger. 355 looks up to see a trembling BETH standing over the deceased soldier.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Are... are you all right?  112 Struggling to stay conscious, 355 asks:

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Yorick? Is Yorick...? But before she can finish her thought, 355’s eyes fall sh Blackness.

dialogues.speaker: TOMBSTONE, ARIZONA. TWO WEEKS LATER.
dialogues.text: INT. DR. MANN’S NEW LABORATORY - MORNING Gradually, this blackness gives way to the sight of a BLU FIGURE looming overhead.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Beth...? As the figure racks into focus, it turns out that it real is Beth. We’re again seeing the world through Yorick’s P.O.V.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Beth, I... I had this fucked-up dream that--

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Doctor! He’s awake! Similar framing from Yorick’s bed-ridden point of view, b now Dr. Mann appears in frame, with Ampersand on her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Damn.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: Nice to see you, too, dick. Pull out to reveal that we’re inside of Dr. Mann’s gliste new futuristic laboratory, where Yorick has apparently be recuperating.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: How long?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: A while. And then some.  113

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Are you guys...? Mann puts a hand on Beth’s back.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: We're fine.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: And 355? Low angle on the doorway to this room, as a figure carryi CANE steps inside.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Never better. Change angles to reveal Agent 355, her face badly bruised her right arm in a cast. She looks like SHIT. Yorick tries to mask his revulsion.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Let me guess, walked into a door? 355 holds up her cane.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Don’t cry for me, gimp. This is for you. Figure you'll need it until your “strength” comes back. She gives the hand-carved walking stick to Yorick, who si up a bit in his hospital bed.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Does it have a sword in it? 355 just squints at him.
