dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Somebody gimme the post-game. Is that Israeli woman...?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: No longer active duty. And we had her troops deported, with a little help from your mother.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: You called my mom?  114

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: She’s the one who told us about this safe house. She doesn’t want the rest of the government knowing where you are until she’s sure they can be trusted.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: And the Amazons?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: Somewhere safe, where they can all be deprogrammed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open tight on Victoria.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Man can imprison our bodies, but he cannot enslave our minds! Pull out to reveal that Victoria is wearing an ORANGE JUMPSUIT, and she’s addressing a crowd of her FELLOW INMA inside of the women’s penitentiary back in Marrisville. T other prisoners cheer with each of Victoria’s declaration

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: We are the chosen few who recognize that the Plague was our emancipation, but we can’t stop until all our sisters are freed from the yoke of the past! As the women continue to applaud, pan over to SONIA, the who tried to seduce Yorick. She’s dressed in the uniform a PRISON GUARD, and as she listens to Victoria speak... s slowly begins to CLAP. INT. DR. MANN’S NEW LABORATORY - MORNING Cut back to Yorick, exactly where we left him.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Well, at least there’s that. Pull out, as Yorick asks a favor from 355 and Mann.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Hey, Doc, Three, you mind if I have a moment?  Mann looks at Beth for approval, and Beth nods. escorts 355 outside. Yorick reaches for his nearby bag.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Beth, there’s something I need to ask you.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: You're looking for this, right? Beth pulls out Yorick’s RING BOX from her pocket. He just stares at it.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: There’s something I have to say first.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: (nervously) Okay.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Yorick, back in New York, what I was trying to tell you before I left. I... I wanted you to know that I thought we should break up. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. I was too scared to say anything. I... I didn’t want to hurt you.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: But...

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: We were going in different directions, Yorick. You recognized it, too. Beth hands him the ring. She’s starting to cry. 115 The doctor  116

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: That’s why you tried so hard to hang on to me, because you knew the world was pulling us apart.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: That was a different world, Beth!

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Maybe, but it would be selfish and... and dishonest to say yes to the last man when I would have said no to the man. Now Yorick is tearing up, too.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: But I’ve changed since then!

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: And so have I. Look, I... I don’t believe in coincidence. There’s a reason my formula worked the way it did, and I have an obligation to stay here with Dr. Mann and help her find new ways of applying it. Beth lovingly touches Yorick.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: And it’s no coincidence that destiny picked you. There's a reason you're still alive, and it wasn’t to save me.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Then why? Why am I here? Beth wipes away Yorick’s tears and kisses him, one last t

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Alas, poor Yorick... that’s the question that separates the men from the boys. EXT. DR. MANN’S NEW LABORATORY - MORNING Cut outside what appears to be an ordinary FARM somewhere the United States, as a hi-tech hatch OPENS IN THE EARTH. 355 and Dr. Mann walk out of it.  355 walks passenger 117

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: You sure you guys will be all right here on your own?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: Yeah, Yorick’s mother said this old shelter was designed to house Congress for fifty years in case the Y2K bug plunged the country into chaos. Thank Christ for misplaced paranoia. over to the parked Yugo and throws her bag in the seat.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Well, I appreciate the parting gift.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: Where are you off to, 355?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: If what you say about the Culper Ring is true, then they might be responsible for more atrocities than just this. I’m going to find out what they were and try to make up for as many as I can.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: You don’t have to pay for the sins of the father, you know.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: All you have to do in life is die, right?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANN
dialogues.text: I guess, ‘cause I’m sure as shit not filing taxes anymore. The two shake hands, before Mann returns to her new home. As 355 finishes loading her stuff into the car, the sound the hatch re-opening is heard off-screen. 355 turns to se Yorick (cane in hand), with Ampersand on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: What, does the hard-as-nails secret agent suck at good-byes?  He stares 118

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Just figured you had more important things to do down there.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Actually, the doc says she’s gotten everything important from Amp and me already. She took all the semen samples she needs while I was out. Not sure I want to know how she took them, but--

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: I hope Beth let you down easy. at 355 in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: You... you knew she was gonna dump me?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: From pretty much the moment you told me about her, yeah. Yorick just kicks at the dirt a bit.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Why is women’s intuition only right when it’s too late to do anything about it?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: It’s never too late, Yorick. I’m sure you two will work it out.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Actually, I told her I’m leaving. 355 stops what she’s doing.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: And going where?

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: I was kinda hoping to hitch a ride with you.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Yorick...  119

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Just hear me out. I know you ladies have the world under control. Beth was telling me the water’s back on in most cities and the nuclear power plants are cooling down and all that... but maybe there’s something out there that someone still needs a man for.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: (a beat) Opening jars?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Yorick, you're safest here.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: You sure about that? What if other... villainesses find out about this place? Burn it to the ground, God forbid. It’s not smart to keep all our sperm in one basket.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: (a little disgusted) You have a way with words.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Does that mean I can tag along? A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Why not. As Ampersand scampers into the Yugo’s back seat, Yorick climbs in shotgun. 355 takes the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 355
dialogues.text: Buckle up. I don’t need the last man on earth flying through my windshield.

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Not the last man, Three. Yorick pulls out a CD from his bag, which he throws in th car’s sound system.  120

dialogues.speaker: YORICK
dialogues.text: Just the only one for now. Jay-Z's “99 Problems” comes to life over the speakers. Agent 355 reaches for the volume, and with a little half- smile, turns it up. We're looking at the car from above now, as it peels away from the hidden shelter, eventually slowing to stop at a in a clearly Y-SHAPED ROAD. We pull out farther, faster and faster, high into the AIR past the CLOUDS, past the UPPER ATMOSPHERE, until we’re o again in SPACE, taking in the serene blue planet, looking much like it did in the moments before the Plague. But this time, a LARGE OBJECT suddenly floats into frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Push in through one of the space station’s tiny windows t reveal a FEMALE ASTRONAUT, the one we heard come over the NASA Ground Control speaker during the opening Plague montage. This woman's checking a complicated control panel.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE ASTRONAUT
dialogues.text: That’s it. The Elektron’s gone from working intermittently to belching hydrogen into the cabin. Even the HAM radio’s dead.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Then the decision’s been made for us. Finally, cut over to two MALE ASTRONAUTS, a bearded RUSSI COSMONAUT and the handsome AFRICAN-AMERICAN TEAM LEADER, hovering in the weightless environment across from their female colleague.

dialogues.speaker: MALE ASTRONAUT
dialogues.text: We're going home. Blackness.
